causalis.eda.eda

EDA utilities for causal analysis (propensity, overlap, balance, weights).

This module provides a lightweight CausalEDA class to quickly assess whether a binary treatment problem is suitable for causal effect estimation. The outputs focus on interpretability: treatment predictability, overlap/positivity, covariate balance before/after weighting, and basic data health.

What the main outputs mean

  • outcome_stats(): DataFrame with comprehensive statistics (count, mean, std, percentiles, min/max) for outcome grouped by treatment.
  • fit_propensity(): Numpy array of cross-validated propensity scores P(T=1|X).
  • confounders_roc_auc(): Float ROC AUC of treatment vs. propensity score. Higher AUC implies treatment is predictable from confounders (more cofounding risk).
  • positivity_check(): Dict with bounds, share_below, share_above, and flag. It reports what share of units have PS outside [low, high]; a large share signals poor overlap (violated positivity).
  • plot_ps_overlap(): Overlaid histograms of PS for treated vs control.
  • confounders_means(): DataFrame with comprehensive balance assessment including means by treatment group, absolute differences, and standardized mean differences (SMD).

Note: The class accepts either the project’s CausalData object (duck-typed) or a CausalDataLite with explicit fields.

   1"""EDA utilities for causal analysis (propensity, overlap, balance, weights).
   2
   3This module provides a lightweight CausalEDA class to quickly assess whether a
   4binary treatment problem is suitable for causal effect estimation. The outputs
   5focus on interpretability: treatment predictability, overlap/positivity,
   6covariate balance before/after weighting, and basic data health.
   7
   8What the main outputs mean
   9
  10- outcome_stats(): DataFrame with comprehensive statistics (count, mean, std, 
  11  percentiles, min/max) for outcome grouped by treatment.
  12- fit_propensity(): Numpy array of cross-validated propensity scores P(T=1|X).
  13- confounders_roc_auc(): Float ROC AUC of treatment vs. propensity score.
  14  Higher AUC implies treatment is predictable from confounders (more cofounding risk).
  15- positivity_check(): Dict with bounds, share_below, share_above, and flag.
  16  It reports what share of units have PS outside [low, high]; a large share
  17  signals poor overlap (violated positivity).
  18- plot_ps_overlap(): Overlaid histograms of PS for treated vs control.
  19- confounders_means(): DataFrame with comprehensive balance assessment including
  20  means by treatment group, absolute differences, and standardized mean differences (SMD).
  21
  22Note: The class accepts either the project’s CausalData object (duck-typed) or a
  23CausalDataLite with explicit fields.
  24"""
  25from __future__ import annotations
  26
  27from dataclasses import dataclass
  28from typing import List, Optional, Dict, Any, Tuple
  29
  30import numpy as np
  31import pandas as pd
  32from sklearn.model_selection import StratifiedKFold, cross_val_predict, KFold
  33from sklearn.metrics import roc_auc_score, mean_squared_error, mean_absolute_error
  34from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder, StandardScaler
  35from sklearn.compose import ColumnTransformer
  36from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
  37from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression, LinearRegression
  38from catboost import CatBoostClassifier, CatBoostRegressor
  39import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
  40
  41
  42import warnings
  43_CK_EDA_WARN_ONCE = set()
  44
  45def _warn_once(name: str, to: str):
  46    key = (name, to)
  47    if key not in _CK_EDA_WARN_ONCE:
  48        warnings.warn(
  49            f"`{name}` is deprecated; use `{to}` instead. "
  50            "This alias will be removed in a future release.",
  51            DeprecationWarning,
  52            stacklevel=2,
  53        )
  54        _CK_EDA_WARN_ONCE.add(key)

  57class PropensityModel:
  58    """A model for m(x) = P(D=1|X) and related diagnostics.
  59    
  60    This class encapsulates propensity m and provides methods for:
  61    - Computing ROC AUC (AUC of D vs m)
  62    - Extracting SHAP values
  63    - Plotting m overlap
  64    - Checking positivity/overlap
  65    
  66    The class is returned by CausalEDA.fit_m() and provides a cleaner
  67    interface for propensity analysis.
  68    """
  69    
  70    def __init__(self, 
  71                 m: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
  72                 d: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
  73                 fitted_model: Any = None,
  74                 feature_names: List[str] = None,
  75                 X_for_shap: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
  76                 cat_features_for_shap: Optional[List[int]] = None,
  77                 propensity_scores: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
  78                 treatment_values: Optional[np.ndarray] = None):
  79        """Initialize PropensityModel with fitted model artifacts.
  80        
  81        Parameters
  82        ----------
  83        m : np.ndarray
  84            Array of m(x) = P(D=1|X)
  85        d : np.ndarray
  86            Array of actual treatment assignments (0/1)
  87        fitted_model : Any
  88            The fitted propensity model
  89        feature_names : List[str]
  90            Names of features used in the model
  91        X_for_shap : Optional[np.ndarray]
  92            Preprocessed feature matrix for SHAP computation
  93        cat_features_for_shap : Optional[List[int]]
  94            Categorical feature indices for SHAP computation
  95        propensity_scores, treatment_values : Optional legacy aliases accepted for back-compat
  96        """
  97        # Back-compat arg names
  98        if m is None and propensity_scores is not None:
  99            _warn_once("propensity_scores (init)", "m")
 100            m = propensity_scores
 101        if d is None and treatment_values is not None:
 102            d = treatment_values
 103        self.m = np.asarray(m) if m is not None else None
 104        self.d = np.asarray(d) if d is not None else None
 105        self.fitted_model = fitted_model
 106        self.feature_names = feature_names
 107        self.X_for_shap = X_for_shap
 108        self.cat_features_for_shap = cat_features_for_shap
 109
 110    @classmethod
 111    def from_kfold(
 112        cls,
 113        X: pd.DataFrame,
 114        t: np.ndarray,
 115        model: Optional[Any] = None,
 116        n_splits: int = 5,
 117        random_state: int = 42,
 118        preprocessor: Optional[ColumnTransformer] = None,
 119    ) -> "PropensityModel":
 120        """Estimate m(x) via K-fold and return a PropensityModel.
 121
 122        Produces out-of-fold m estimates using StratifiedKFold. If no
 123        model is provided, a fast LogisticRegression is used. Categorical
 124        features are one-hot encoded and numeric features standardized by
 125        default using a ColumnTransformer.
 126        """
 127        # Ensure inputs are aligned
 128        if isinstance(X, pd.DataFrame):
 129            feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
 130        else:
 131            raise ValueError("X must be a pandas DataFrame with named columns.")
 132        t = np.asarray(t).astype(int)
 133        # validate binary treatment
 134        if not np.isin(t, [0, 1]).all():
 135            raise ValueError("Treatment must be binary {0,1}.")
 136
 137        # Preprocessor default
 138        if preprocessor is None:
 139            num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
 140            cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
 141            num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))])
 142            preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
 143                transformers=[
 144                    ("num", num_transformer, num),
 145                    ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
 146                ],
 147                remainder="drop",
 148            )
 149
 150        # Model default
 151        if model is None:
 152            model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=1000)
 153
 154        cv = StratifiedKFold(n_splits=n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=random_state)
 155
 156        # Compute out-of-fold probabilities
 157        if isinstance(model, CatBoostClassifier):
 158            import warnings
 159            ps = np.zeros(len(X))
 160            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 161                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 162                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 163                    for tr_idx, te_idx in cv.split(X, t):
 164                        X_tr, X_te = X.iloc[tr_idx], X.iloc[te_idx]
 165                        t_tr = t[tr_idx]
 166                        X_tr_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_tr)
 167                        X_te_p = preprocessor.transform(X_te)
 168                        fold_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
 169                        fold_model.fit(X_tr_p, t_tr)
 170                        ps[te_idx] = fold_model.predict_proba(X_te_p)[:, 1]
 171            # Fit final model for SHAP
 172            X_full_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X)
 173            final_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_state=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
 174            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 175                final_model.fit(X_full_p, t)
 176            X_for_shap = X_full_p
 177            fitted = final_model
 178            # use transformed feature names for SHAP alignment
 179            try:
 180                feature_names = preprocessor.get_feature_names_out().tolist()
 181            except Exception:
 182                feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(X_full_p.shape[1])]
 183        else:
 184            pipe = Pipeline([("prep", preprocessor), ("clf", model)])
 185            import warnings
 186            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 187                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 188                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 189                    ps = cross_val_predict(pipe, X, t, cv=cv, method="predict_proba")[:, 1]
 190                    pipe.fit(X, t)
 191            fitted = pipe
 192            X_for_shap = None
 193
 194        # clip for stability
 195        ps = np.clip(ps, 1e-6, 1 - 1e-6)
 196
 197        return cls(
 198            propensity_scores=ps,
 199            treatment_values=t,
 200            fitted_model=fitted,
 201            feature_names=feature_names,
 202            X_for_shap=X_for_shap,
 203        )
 204    
 205    @property
 206    def roc_auc(self) -> float:
 207        """Compute ROC AUC of treatment assignment vs. m(x).
 208        
 209        Higher AUC means treatment is more predictable from confounders,
 210        indicating stronger systematic differences between groups (potential
 211        cofounding). Values near 0.5 suggest random-like assignment.
 212        
 213        Returns
 214        -------
 215        float
 216            ROC AUC score between 0 and 1
 217        """
 218        return float(roc_auc_score(self.d, self.m))
 219    
 220    @property
 221    def shap(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 222        """Return feature attribution from the fitted propensity model.
 223        
 224        For CatBoost models: returns SHAP-based attributions with both signed mean (shap_mean)
 225        and magnitude (shap_mean_abs), sorted by shap_mean_abs.
 226        
 227        For sklearn linear models (LogisticRegression): returns absolute coefficients under
 228        column 'coef_abs' (not SHAP), sorted descending.
 229        """
 230        # Extract SHAP values or feature importance based on model type
 231        if isinstance(self.fitted_model, CatBoostClassifier):
 232            try:
 233                from catboost import Pool
 234                if self.X_for_shap is None:
 235                    raise RuntimeError("Preprocessed data for SHAP computation not available.")
 236                shap_pool = Pool(data=self.X_for_shap)
 237                shap_values = self.fitted_model.get_feature_importance(type='ShapValues', data=shap_pool)
 238                shap_values_no_bias = shap_values[:, :-1]
 239                shap_mean = np.mean(shap_values_no_bias, axis=0)
 240                shap_mean_abs = np.mean(np.abs(shap_values_no_bias), axis=0)
 241                feature_names = list(self.feature_names)
 242                if len(feature_names) != shap_values_no_bias.shape[1]:
 243                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match SHAP values. Ensure transformed names are used.")
 244                result_df = pd.DataFrame({
 245                    'feature': feature_names,
 246                    'shap_mean': shap_mean,
 247                    'shap_mean_abs': shap_mean_abs,
 248                })
 249                # Sort by absolute shap_mean (test expects this order)
 250                result_df['abs_shap_mean'] = np.abs(result_df['shap_mean'].values)
 251                result_df = result_df.sort_values('abs_shap_mean', ascending=False).drop(columns=['abs_shap_mean']).reset_index(drop=True)
 252                # Augment with probability-scale metrics using baseline p0 = mean propensity score
 253                p0 = float(np.mean(self.propensity_scores))
 254                p0 = float(np.clip(p0, 1e-9, 1 - 1e-9))
 255                logit_p0 = float(np.log(p0 / (1.0 - p0)))
 256                # result_df['odds_mult_abs'] = np.exp(result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values)
 257                result_df['exact_pp_change_abs'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values))) - p0
 258                result_df['exact_pp_change_signed'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean'].values))) - p0
 259                return result_df
 260            except Exception as e:
 261                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract SHAP values from CatBoost model: {e}")
 262        elif hasattr(self.fitted_model, 'named_steps') and hasattr(self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('clf'), 'coef_'):
 263            try:
 264                clf = self.fitted_model.named_steps['clf']
 265                coef_abs = np.abs(clf.coef_[0])
 266                prep = self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('prep')
 267                if hasattr(prep, 'get_feature_names_out'):
 268                    try:
 269                        feature_names = [str(n) for n in prep.get_feature_names_out()]
 270                    except Exception:
 271                        feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
 272                else:
 273                    feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
 274                if len(coef_abs) != len(feature_names):
 275                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match coefficients.")
 276                df = pd.DataFrame({'feature': feature_names, 'importance': coef_abs, 'coef_abs': coef_abs}).sort_values('importance', ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)
 277                return df
 278            except Exception as e:
 279                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract feature importance from sklearn model: {e}")
 280        else:
 281            raise RuntimeError(f"Feature importance extraction not supported for model type: {type(self.fitted_model)}")
 282    
 283    @property
 284    def propensity_scores(self):
 285        _warn_once("propensity_scores", "m")
 286        return self.m
 287
 288    def plot_m_overlap(
 289            self,
 290            clip=(0.01, 0.99),
 291            bins="fd",
 292            kde=True,
 293            shade_overlap=True,
 294            ax=None,
 295            figsize=(9, 5.5),
 296            dpi=220,
 297            font_scale=1.15,
 298            save=None,
 299            save_dpi=None,
 300            transparent=False,
 301            color_t=None,  # None -> use Matplotlib defaults
 302            color_c=None,  # None -> use Matplotlib defaults
 303    ):
 304        """
 305        Overlap plot for m(x)=P(D=1|X) with high-res rendering.
 306        - x in [0,1]
 307        - Stable NumPy KDE w/ boundary reflection (no SciPy warnings)
 308        - Uses Matplotlib default colors unless color_t/color_c are provided
 309        """
 310        import numpy as np
 311        import matplotlib as mpl
 312        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 313
 314        # ------- Helpers --------------------------------------------------------
 315        def _silverman_bandwidth(x):
 316            x = np.asarray(x, float)
 317            n = x.size
 318            if n < 2:
 319                return 0.04
 320            sd = np.std(x, ddof=1)
 321            iqr = np.subtract(*np.percentile(x, [75, 25]))
 322            s = sd if iqr <= 0 else min(sd, iqr / 1.34)
 323            h = 0.9 * s * n ** (-1 / 5)
 324            return float(max(h, 0.02))
 325
 326        def _kde_reflect(x, xs, h):
 327            x = np.asarray(x, float)
 328            if x.size == 0:
 329                return np.zeros_like(xs)
 330            if x.size < 2 or np.std(x) < 1e-8:
 331                mu = float(np.mean(x)) if x.size else 0.5
 332                h0 = max(h, 0.02)
 333                z = (xs - mu) / h0
 334                return np.exp(-0.5 * z ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h0)
 335            xr = np.concatenate([x, -x, 2 - x])  # reflect at 0 and 1
 336            diff = (xs[None, :] - xr[:, None]) / h
 337            kern = np.exp(-0.5 * diff ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h)
 338            return kern.mean(axis=0)
 339
 340        def _patch_color(patches, fallback):
 341            # Grab facecolor from the first bar; fallback to cycle color if needed
 342            for p in patches:
 343                fc = p.get_facecolor()
 344                if fc is not None:
 345                    return fc  # RGBA
 346            return fallback
 347
 348        # ------- Data -----------------------------------------------------------
 349        d = np.asarray(self.d).astype(int)
 350        m = np.asarray(self.m, dtype=float)
 351        mask = np.isfinite(m) & np.isfinite(d)
 352        d, m = d[mask], m[mask]
 353        mt = m[d == 1]
 354        mc = m[d == 0]
 355        if mt.size == 0 or mc.size == 0:
 356            raise ValueError("Both treated and control must have at least one observation after cleaning.")
 357
 358        # Clamp to [0,1] to keep plot stable and inside bounds
 359        mtp = np.clip(mt, 0.0, 1.0)
 360        mcp = np.clip(mc, 0.0, 1.0)
 361
 362        # ------- Figure/axes with high DPI & scaled fonts ----------------------
 363        rc = {
 364            "font.size": 11 * font_scale,
 365            "axes.titlesize": 13 * font_scale,
 366            "axes.labelsize": 12 * font_scale,
 367            "legend.fontsize": 10 * font_scale,
 368            "xtick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
 369            "ytick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
 370        }
 371        with mpl.rc_context(rc):
 372            if ax is None:
 373                fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=figsize, dpi=dpi)
 374            else:
 375                fig = ax.figure
 376                try:
 377                    fig.set_dpi(dpi)
 378                except Exception:
 379                    pass
 380
 381            # ------- Histograms (ALWAYS [0,1]) ---------------------------------
 382            ht = ax.hist(mtp, bins=bins, range=(0.0, 1.0), density=True,
 383                         alpha=0.45, label=f"Treated (n={mt.size})",
 384                         edgecolor="white", linewidth=0.6,
 385                         color=color_t)  # None -> default color
 386            hc = ax.hist(mcp, bins=bins, range=(0.0, 1.0), density=True,
 387                         alpha=0.45, label=f"Control (n={mc.size})",
 388                         edgecolor="white", linewidth=0.6,
 389                         color=color_c)  # None -> default color
 390
 391            # Determine the actual colors used (so KDE/means match the bars)
 392            cycle = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key().get("color", ["C0", "C1"])
 393            used_t = color_t or _patch_color(ht[2], cycle[0])
 394            used_c = color_c or _patch_color(hc[2], cycle[1])
 395
 396            # ------- KDE (stable NumPy implementation) -------------------------
 397            if kde:
 398                if clip:
 399                    lo, hi = np.quantile(np.clip(m, 0, 1), [clip[0], clip[1]])
 400                    lo, hi = float(max(0.0, lo)), float(min(1.0, hi))
 401                    if not (hi > lo):
 402                        lo, hi = 0.0, 1.0
 403                else:
 404                    lo, hi = 0.0, 1.0
 405
 406                xs = np.linspace(0.0, 1.0, 800)
 407                h_t = _silverman_bandwidth(mtp)
 408                h_c = _silverman_bandwidth(mcp)
 409                yt = _kde_reflect(mtp, xs, h_t)
 410                yc = _kde_reflect(mcp, xs, h_c)
 411
 412                ax.plot(xs, yt, linewidth=2.2, label="Treated (KDE)", color=used_t, antialiased=True)
 413                ax.plot(xs, yc, linewidth=2.2, linestyle="--", label="Control (KDE)", color=used_c, antialiased=True)
 414
 415                if shade_overlap:
 416                    y_min = np.minimum(yt, yc)
 417                    ax.fill_between(xs, y_min, 0, alpha=0.12, color="grey", rasterized=False)
 418
 419            # ------- Means ------------------------------------------------------
 420            ax.axvline(float(mtp.mean()), linestyle=":", linewidth=1.8, color=used_t, alpha=0.95)
 421            ax.axvline(float(mcp.mean()), linestyle=":", linewidth=1.8, color=used_c, alpha=0.95)
 422
 423            # ------- Cosmetics --------------------------------------------------
 424            ax.set_xlabel(r"$m(x) = \mathbb{P}(D=1 \mid X)$")
 425            ax.set_ylabel("Density")
 426            ax.set_title("Propensity Overlap by Treatment Group")
 427            ax.set_xlim(0.0, 1.0)
 428            ax.grid(True, linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
 429            for spine in ("top", "right"):
 430                ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)
 431            ax.legend(frameon=False)
 432            fig.tight_layout()
 433
 434            # ------- Optional save ---------------------------------------------
 435            if save is not None:
 436                ext = str(save).lower().split(".")[-1]
 437                _dpi = save_dpi or (300 if ext in {"png", "jpg", "jpeg", "tif", "tiff"} else dpi)
 438                fig.savefig(
 439                    save, dpi=_dpi, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.1,
 440                    transparent=transparent,
 441                    facecolor="none" if transparent else "white"
 442                )
 443
 444        return fig
 445
 446    def positivity_check_m(self, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (0.05, 0.95)) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 447        """Check overlap/positivity for m(x) based on thresholds."""
 448        low, high = bounds
 449        m = self.m
 450        return {
 451            "bounds": bounds,
 452            "share_below": float((m < low).mean()),
 453            "share_above": float((m > high).mean()),
 454            "flag": bool(((m < low).mean() + (m > high).mean()) > 0.02),
 455        }
 456
 457    # Back-compat shims
 458    def ps_graph(self, *args, **kwargs):
 459        _warn_once("ps_graph()", "plot_m_overlap()")
 460        return self.plot_m_overlap(*args, **kwargs)
 461
 462    def positivity_check(self, *args, **kwargs):
 463        _warn_once("positivity_check()", "positivity_check_m()")
 464        return self.positivity_check_m(*args, **kwargs)
 465
 466
 467class OutcomeModel:
 468    """A model for outcome prediction and related diagnostics.
 469
 470    This class encapsulates outcome predictions and provides methods for:
 471    - Computing RMSE and MAE regression metrics
 472    - Extracting SHAP values for outcome prediction
 473
 474    The class is returned by CausalEDA.outcome_fit() and provides a cleaner
 475    interface for outcome model analysis.
 476    """
 477
 478    def __init__(self,
 479                 predicted_outcomes: np.ndarray,
 480                 actual_outcomes: np.ndarray,
 481                 fitted_model: Any,
 482                 feature_names: List[str],
 483                 X_for_shap: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
 484                 cat_features_for_shap: Optional[List[int]] = None):
 485        """Initialize OutcomeModel with fitted model artifacts.
 486
 487        Parameters
 488        ----------
 489        predicted_outcomes : np.ndarray
 490            Array of predicted outcome values
 491        actual_outcomes : np.ndarray
 492            Array of actual outcome values
 493        fitted_model : Any
 494            The fitted outcome prediction model
 495        feature_names : List[str]
 496            Names of features used in the model (confounders only)
 497        X_for_shap : Optional[np.ndarray]
 498            Preprocessed feature matrix for SHAP computation
 499        cat_features_for_shap : Optional[List[int]]
 500            Categorical feature indices for SHAP computation
 501        """
 502        self.predicted_outcomes = predicted_outcomes
 503        self.actual_outcomes = actual_outcomes
 504        self.fitted_model = fitted_model
 505        self.feature_names = feature_names
 506        self.X_for_shap = X_for_shap
 507        self.cat_features_for_shap = cat_features_for_shap
 508
 509    @classmethod
 510    def from_kfold(
 511        cls,
 512        X: pd.DataFrame,
 513        y: np.ndarray,
 514        model: Optional[Any] = None,
 515        n_splits: int = 5,
 516        random_state: int = 42,
 517        preprocessor: Optional[ColumnTransformer] = None,
 518    ) -> "OutcomeModel":
 519        """Estimate an outcome model via K-fold and return an OutcomeModel.
 520
 521        Produces out-of-fold predictions using KFold. If no model is provided,
 522        a fast LinearRegression is used. Categorical features are one-hot
 523        encoded and numeric features standardized by default.
 524        """
 525        if not isinstance(X, pd.DataFrame):
 526            raise ValueError("X must be a pandas DataFrame with named columns.")
 527        feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
 528        y = np.asarray(y)
 529
 530        # Preprocessor default
 531        if preprocessor is None:
 532            num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
 533            cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
 534            num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))])
 535            preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
 536                transformers=[
 537                    ("num", num_transformer, num),
 538                    ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
 539                ],
 540                remainder="drop",
 541            )
 542
 543        # Model default
 544        if model is None:
 545            model = LinearRegression()
 546
 547        cv = KFold(n_splits=n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=random_state)
 548
 549        if isinstance(model, CatBoostRegressor):
 550            import warnings
 551            preds = np.zeros(len(X))
 552            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 553                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 554                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 555                    for tr_idx, te_idx in cv.split(X, y):
 556                        X_tr, X_te = X.iloc[tr_idx], X.iloc[te_idx]
 557                        y_tr = y[tr_idx]
 558                        X_tr_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_tr)
 559                        X_te_p = preprocessor.transform(X_te)
 560                        fold_model = CatBoostRegressor(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
 561                        fold_model.fit(X_tr_p, y_tr)
 562                        preds[te_idx] = fold_model.predict(X_te_p)
 563            # Fit final model for SHAP
 564            X_full_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X)
 565            final_model = CatBoostRegressor(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
 566            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 567                final_model.fit(X_full_p, y)
 568            fitted = final_model
 569            X_for_shap = X_full_p
 570        else:
 571            pipe = Pipeline([("prep", preprocessor), ("reg", model)])
 572            import warnings
 573            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 574                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 575                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 576                    preds = cross_val_predict(pipe, X, y, cv=cv)
 577                    pipe.fit(X, y)
 578            fitted = pipe
 579            X_for_shap = None
 580
 581        return cls(
 582            predicted_outcomes=preds,
 583            actual_outcomes=y,
 584            fitted_model=fitted,
 585            feature_names=feature_names,
 586            X_for_shap=X_for_shap,
 587        )
 588    
 589    @property
 590    def scores(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
 591        """Compute regression metrics (RMSE and MAE) for outcome predictions.
 592        
 593        Returns
 594        -------
 595        Dict[str, float]
 596            Dictionary containing:
 597            - 'rmse': Root Mean Squared Error
 598            - 'mae': Mean Absolute Error
 599        """
 600        mse = mean_squared_error(self.actual_outcomes, self.predicted_outcomes)
 601        rmse = np.sqrt(mse)
 602        mae = mean_absolute_error(self.actual_outcomes, self.predicted_outcomes)
 603        
 604        return {
 605            'rmse': float(rmse),
 606            'mae': float(mae)
 607        }
 608    
 609    @property
 610    def shap(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 611        """Return SHAP values from the fitted outcome prediction model.
 612        
 613        SHAP values show the directional contribution of each feature to 
 614        outcome prediction, where positive values increase the predicted 
 615        outcome and negative values decrease it.
 616        
 617        Returns
 618        -------
 619        pd.DataFrame
 620            For CatBoost models: DataFrame with columns 'feature' and 'shap_mean',
 621            where 'shap_mean' represents the mean SHAP value across all samples.
 622            
 623            For sklearn models: DataFrame with columns 'feature' and 'importance'
 624            (absolute coefficient values, for backward compatibility).
 625            
 626        Raises
 627        ------
 628        RuntimeError
 629            If the fitted model does not support SHAP values extraction.
 630        """
 631        # Extract SHAP values or feature importance based on model type
 632        if isinstance(self.fitted_model, CatBoostRegressor):
 633            # Use CatBoost's SHAP values for directional feature contributions
 634            try:
 635                # Import Pool for SHAP computation
 636                from catboost import Pool
 637                
 638                # Check if we have the required data for SHAP computation
 639                if self.X_for_shap is None:
 640                    raise RuntimeError("Preprocessed data for SHAP computation not available.")
 641                
 642                # Create Pool object for SHAP computation (numeric-only after preprocessing)
 643                shap_pool = Pool(data=self.X_for_shap)
 644                
 645                # Get SHAP values - returns array of shape (n_samples, n_features + 1) 
 646                # where the last column is the bias term
 647                shap_values = self.fitted_model.get_feature_importance(type='ShapValues', data=shap_pool)
 648                
 649                # Remove bias term (last column) and compute mean SHAP values across samples
 650                # This gives us the average directional contribution of each feature
 651                shap_values_no_bias = shap_values[:, :-1]  # Remove bias column
 652                importance_values = np.mean(shap_values_no_bias, axis=0)  # Mean across samples
 653                
 654                feature_names = self.feature_names
 655                column_name = 'shap_mean'  # Use different column name to indicate SHAP values
 656                
 657            except Exception as e:
 658                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract SHAP values from CatBoost model: {e}")
 659        
 660        elif hasattr(self.fitted_model, 'named_steps') and hasattr(self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('clf'), 'coef_'):
 661            # Handle sklearn pipeline with linear regression
 662            try:
 663                clf = self.fitted_model.named_steps['clf']
 664                # For linear regression, use absolute coefficients as importance
 665                importance_values = np.abs(clf.coef_)
 666                
 667                # Need to map back to original feature names through preprocessing
 668                # For simplicity, if we have preprocessed features, we'll use the original feature names
 669                # and aggregate importance for one-hot encoded categorical features
 670                prep = self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('prep')
 671                if hasattr(prep, 'get_feature_names_out'):
 672                    try:
 673                        # Try to get feature names from preprocessor
 674                        transformed_names = prep.get_feature_names_out()
 675                        feature_names = [str(name) for name in transformed_names]
 676                    except:
 677                        # Fallback to original feature names if transformation fails
 678                        feature_names = self.feature_names
 679                        if len(importance_values) != len(feature_names):
 680                            # If lengths don't match due to one-hot encoding, we can't map back easily
 681                            # Just use indices as feature names
 682                            feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(importance_values))]
 683                else:
 684                    feature_names = self.feature_names
 685                
 686                column_name = 'importance'  # Keep backward compatibility for sklearn models
 687                    
 688            except Exception as e:
 689                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract feature importance from sklearn model: {e}")
 690        
 691        else:
 692            raise RuntimeError(f"Feature importance extraction not supported for model type: {type(self.fitted_model)}")
 693        
 694        # Ensure we have matching lengths
 695        if len(importance_values) != len(feature_names):
 696            # This can happen with preprocessing transformations
 697            # Create generic feature names if needed
 698            if len(importance_values) > len(feature_names):
 699                feature_names = feature_names + [f"transformed_feature_{i}" for i in range(len(feature_names), len(importance_values))]
 700            else:
 701                feature_names = feature_names[:len(importance_values)]
 702        
 703        # Create DataFrame with appropriate column name
 704        result_df = pd.DataFrame({
 705            'feature': feature_names,
 706            column_name: importance_values
 707        })
 708        
 709        # Sort appropriately: by absolute value for SHAP values (to show most impactful features),
 710        # by value for regular importance (higher is better)
 711        if column_name == 'shap_mean':
 712            # For SHAP values, sort by absolute value to show most impactful features first
 713            result_df = result_df.reindex(result_df[column_name].abs().sort_values(ascending=False).index)
 714        else:
 715            # For regular importance, sort by value (descending)
 716            result_df = result_df.sort_values(column_name, ascending=False)
 717        
 718        result_df = result_df.reset_index(drop=True)
 719        return result_df
 720
 721
 722
 723
 724# Optional lightweight dataclass for standalone usage, but CausalEDA also
 725# supports the existing causalis.data.CausalData which uses `confounders`.
 726@dataclass
 727class CausalDataLite:
 728    """A minimal container for dataset roles used by CausalEDA.
 729
 730    Attributes
 731    - df: The full pandas DataFrame containing treatment, outcome and covariates.
 732    - treatment: Column name of the binary treatment indicator (0/1).
 733    - outcome: Column name of the outcome variable.
 734    - confounders: List of covariate column names used to model treatment.
 735    """
 736    df: pd.DataFrame
 737    treatment: str
 738    outcome: str
 739    confounders: List[str]
 740
 741
 742def _extract_roles(data_obj: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 743    """Extract dataset roles from various supported data containers.
 744
 745    Accepts:
 746    - CausalDataLite
 747    - Project's CausalData (duck-typed: attributes df, treatment, outcome,
 748      and confounders)
 749    - Any object exposing the same attributes/properties
 750
 751    Returns a dict with keys: df, treatment, outcome, confounders.
 752    If confounders are absent, it assumes all columns except
 753    treatment/outcome are confounders.
 754    """
 755    # Direct dataclass-like attributes
 756    df = getattr(data_obj, "df")
 757    treatment_attr = getattr(data_obj, "treatment")
 758    outcome_attr = getattr(data_obj, "outcome")
 759
 760    # If these are Series (as in causalis.data.CausalData properties), convert to column names
 761    if isinstance(treatment_attr, pd.Series):
 762        treatment = treatment_attr.name
 763    else:
 764        treatment = treatment_attr
 765    if isinstance(outcome_attr, pd.Series):
 766        outcome = outcome_attr.name
 767    else:
 768        outcome = outcome_attr
 769
 770    if hasattr(data_obj, "confounders") and getattr(data_obj, "confounders") is not None:
 771        # causalis.data.CausalData.confounders returns a List[str]
 772        confs = list(getattr(data_obj, "confounders"))
 773    else:
 774        # Last resort: assume all columns except treatment/outcome are confounders
 775        confs = [c for c in df.columns if c not in {treatment, outcome}]
 776
 777    return {"df": df, "treatment": treatment, "outcome": outcome, "confounders": confs}
 778
 779
 780class CausalEDA:
 781    """Exploratory diagnostics for causal designs with binary treatment.
 782
 783    The class exposes methods to:
 784    
 785    - Summarize outcome by treatment and naive mean difference.
 786    - Estimate cross-validated propensity scores and assess treatment
 787      predictability (AUC) and positivity/overlap.
 788    - Inspect covariate balance via standardized mean differences (SMD)
 789      before/after IPTW weighting; visualize with a love plot.
 790    - Inspect weight distributions and effective sample size (ESS).
 791    """
 792    def __init__(self, data: Any, ps_model: Optional[Any] = None, n_splits: int = 5, random_state: int = 42):
 793        roles = _extract_roles(data)
 794        self.d = CausalDataLite(df=roles["df"], treatment=roles["treatment"], outcome=roles["outcome"], confounders=roles["confounders"])
 795        self.n_splits = n_splits
 796        self.random_state = random_state
 797        self.ps_model = ps_model or CatBoostClassifier(
 798            thread_count=-1,  # Use all available threads
 799            random_seed=random_state,
 800            verbose=False,  # Suppress training output
 801            allow_writing_files=False
 802        )
 803
 804        # Preprocessing: always make features numeric via OneHotEncoder for categoricals
 805        X = self.d.df[self.d.confounders]
 806        num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
 807        cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
 808
 809        num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
 810            ("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))
 811        ])
 812        self.preproc = ColumnTransformer(
 813            transformers=[
 814                ("num", num_transformer, num),
 815                ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
 816            ],
 817            remainder="drop",
 818        )
 819        
 820        self.ps_pipe = Pipeline([("prep", self.preproc), ("clf", self.ps_model)])
 821        # Optional: clarify no native categorical indices are used post-OHE
 822        self.cat_features = None
 823
 824    # ---------- basics ----------
 825
 826    def data_shape(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
 827        """Return the shape information of the causal dataset.
 828
 829        Returns a dict with:
 830        - n_rows: number of rows (observations) in the dataset
 831        - n_columns: number of columns (features) in the dataset
 832        
 833        This provides a quick overview of the dataset dimensions for 
 834        exploratory analysis and reporting purposes.
 835        
 836        Returns
 837        -------
 838        Dict[str, int]
 839            Dictionary containing 'n_rows' and 'n_columns' keys with 
 840            corresponding integer values representing the dataset dimensions.
 841        
 842        Examples
 843        --------
 844        >>> eda = CausalEDA(causal_data)
 845        >>> shape_info = eda.data_shape()
 846        >>> print(f"Dataset has {shape_info['n_rows']} rows and {shape_info['n_columns']} columns")
 847        """
 848        df = self.d.df
 849        n_rows, n_columns = df.shape
 850        return {"n_rows": n_rows, "n_columns": n_columns}
 851
 852
 853    def outcome_stats(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 854        """Comprehensive outcome statistics grouped by treatment.
 855
 856        Returns a DataFrame with detailed outcome statistics for each treatment group,
 857        including count, mean, std, min, various percentiles, and max.
 858        This method provides comprehensive outcome analysis and returns
 859        data in a clean DataFrame format suitable for reporting.
 860
 861        Returns
 862        -------
 863        pd.DataFrame
 864            DataFrame with treatment groups as index and the following columns:
 865            - count: number of observations in each group
 866            - mean: average outcome value
 867            - std: standard deviation of outcome
 868            - min: minimum outcome value
 869            - p10: 10th percentile
 870            - p25: 25th percentile (Q1)
 871            - median: 50th percentile (median)
 872            - p75: 75th percentile (Q3)
 873            - p90: 90th percentile
 874            - max: maximum outcome value
 875
 876        Examples
 877        --------
 878        >>> eda = CausalEDA(causal_data)
 879        >>> stats = eda.outcome_stats()
 880        >>> print(stats)
 881                count      mean       std       min       p10       p25    median       p75       p90       max
 882        treatment                                                                                                
 883        0        3000  5.123456  2.345678  0.123456  2.345678  3.456789  5.123456  6.789012  7.890123  9.876543
 884        1        2000  6.789012  2.456789  0.234567  3.456789  4.567890  6.789012  8.901234  9.012345  10.987654
 885        """
 886        df, t, y = self.d.df, self.d.treatment, self.d.outcome
 887        
 888        # Ensure treatment is numeric for grouping
 889        if not pd.api.types.is_numeric_dtype(df[t]):
 890            raise ValueError("Treatment must be numeric 0/1 for outcome_stats().")
 891        
 892        # Create grouped object for multiple operations
 893        grouped = df.groupby(t)[y]
 894        
 895        # Calculate basic statistics using built-in methods
 896        basic_stats = grouped.agg(['count', 'mean', 'std', 'min', 'median', 'max'])
 897        
 898        # Calculate percentiles separately to avoid pandas aggregation mixing issues
 899        p10 = grouped.quantile(0.10)
 900        p25 = grouped.quantile(0.25) 
 901        p75 = grouped.quantile(0.75)
 902        p90 = grouped.quantile(0.90)
 903        
 904        # Combine all statistics into a single DataFrame
 905        stats_df = pd.DataFrame({
 906            'count': basic_stats['count'],
 907            'mean': basic_stats['mean'],
 908            'std': basic_stats['std'],
 909            'min': basic_stats['min'],
 910            'p10': p10,
 911            'p25': p25,
 912            'median': basic_stats['median'],
 913            'p75': p75,
 914            'p90': p90,
 915            'max': basic_stats['max']
 916        })
 917        
 918        # Ensure the index is named appropriately
 919        stats_df.index.name = 'treatment'
 920        
 921        return stats_df
 922
 923    # ---------- propensity & overlap ----------
 924    def fit_m(self) -> 'PropensityModel':
 925        """Estimate cross-validated m(x) = P(D=1|X).
 926
 927        Uses a preprocessing + classifier setup with stratified K-fold to generate
 928        out-of-fold probabilities. For CatBoost, data are one-hot encoded via the
 929        configured ColumnTransformer before fitting. Returns a PropensityModel.
 930        """
 931        df = self.d.df
 932        X = df[self.d.confounders]
 933        t = df[self.d.treatment].astype(int).values
 934        if not np.isin(t, [0, 1]).all():
 935            raise ValueError("Treatment must be binary {0,1}.")
 936        cv = StratifiedKFold(n_splits=self.n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=self.random_state)
 937
 938        if isinstance(self.ps_model, CatBoostClassifier):
 939            import warnings
 940            ps = np.zeros(len(X))
 941            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 942                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 943                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 944                    for train_idx, test_idx in cv.split(X, t):
 945                        X_train, X_test = X.iloc[train_idx], X.iloc[test_idx]
 946                        t_train = t[train_idx]
 947                        X_train_prep = self.preproc.fit_transform(X_train)
 948                        X_test_prep = self.preproc.transform(X_test)
 949                        model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=self.random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
 950                        model.fit(X_train_prep, t_train)
 951                        ps[test_idx] = model.predict_proba(X_test_prep)[:, 1]
 952        else:
 953            import warnings
 954            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 955                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 956                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 957                    ps = cross_val_predict(self.ps_pipe, X, t, cv=cv, method="predict_proba")[:, 1]
 958
 959        m = np.clip(ps, 1e-6, 1 - 1e-6)
 960        self._m = m
 961
 962        if isinstance(self.ps_model, CatBoostClassifier):
 963            X_full_prep = self.preproc.fit_transform(X)
 964            final_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=self.random_state, verbose=False)
 965            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 966                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 967                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 968                    final_model.fit(X_full_prep, t)
 969            self._fitted_model = final_model
 970            try:
 971                self._feature_names = self.preproc.get_feature_names_out().tolist()
 972            except Exception:
 973                self._feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(X_full_prep.shape[1])]
 974            self._X_for_shap = X_full_prep
 975        else:
 976            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 977                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 978                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 979                    self.ps_pipe.fit(X, t)
 980            self._fitted_model = self.ps_pipe
 981            self._feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
 982
 983        return PropensityModel(
 984            m=m,
 985            d=t,
 986            fitted_model=self._fitted_model,
 987            feature_names=self._feature_names,
 988            X_for_shap=getattr(self, '_X_for_shap', None)
 989        )
 990
 991    # Back-compat shim
 992    def fit_propensity(self) -> 'PropensityModel':
 993        _warn_once("fit_propensity()", "fit_m()")
 994        return self.fit_m()
 995
 996    def outcome_fit(self, outcome_model: Optional[Any] = None) -> 'OutcomeModel':
 997        """Fit a regression model to predict outcome from confounders only.
 998
 999        Uses a preprocessing+CatBoost regressor pipeline with K-fold
1000        cross_val_predict to generate out-of-fold predictions. CatBoost uses
1001        all available threads and handles categorical features natively. Returns an
1002        OutcomeModel instance containing predicted outcomes and diagnostic methods.
1003        
1004        The outcome model predicts the baseline outcome from confounders only,
1005        excluding treatment. This is essential for proper causal analysis.
1006        
1007        Parameters
1008        ----------
1009        outcome_model : Optional[Any]
1010            Custom regression model to use. If None, uses CatBoostRegressor.
1011            
1012        Returns
1013        -------
1014        OutcomeModel
1015            An OutcomeModel instance with methods for:
1016            - scores: RMSE and MAE regression metrics
1017            - shap: SHAP values DataFrame property for outcome prediction
1018        """
1019        df = self.d.df
1020        # Features: confounders only (treatment excluded for proper causal analysis)
1021        X = df[self.d.confounders]
1022        y = df[self.d.outcome].values
1023        cv = KFold(n_splits=self.n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=self.random_state)
1024        
1025        # Default to CatBoostRegressor if no custom model provided
1026        if outcome_model is None:
1027            outcome_model = CatBoostRegressor(
1028                thread_count=-1,
1029                random_seed=self.random_state,
1030                verbose=False,
1031                allow_writing_files=False
1032            )
1033        
1034        # Identify numeric and categorical features for preprocessing
1035        num_features = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
1036        cat_features = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num_features]
1037        
1038        # Setup preprocessing: always OHE categoricals so model input is numeric
1039        num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
1040            ("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))
1041        ])
1042        preproc = ColumnTransformer(
1043            transformers=[
1044                ("num", num_transformer, num_features),
1045                ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat_features),
1046            ],
1047            remainder="drop",
1048        )
1049        
1050        # Special handling for CatBoost to properly pass categorical features
1051        if isinstance(outcome_model, CatBoostRegressor):
1052            import warnings
1053            
1054            predictions = np.zeros(len(X))
1055            
1056            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1057                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1058                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1059                    
1060                    for train_idx, test_idx in cv.split(X, y):
1061                        # Prepare data for this fold
1062                        X_train, X_test = X.iloc[train_idx], X.iloc[test_idx]
1063                        y_train = y[train_idx]
1064                        
1065                        # Apply preprocessing
1066                        X_train_prep = preproc.fit_transform(X_train)
1067                        X_test_prep = preproc.transform(X_test)
1068                        
1069                        # Create and train CatBoost model for this fold
1070                        model = CatBoostRegressor(
1071                            thread_count=-1,
1072                            random_seed=self.random_state,
1073                            verbose=False,
1074                            allow_writing_files=False
1075                        )
1076                        
1077                        # All features are numeric after preprocessing; no cat_features needed
1078                        model.fit(X_train_prep, y_train)
1079                        predictions[test_idx] = model.predict(X_test_prep)
1080        else:
1081            # Use standard sklearn pipeline for non-CatBoost models
1082            pipeline = Pipeline([("prep", preproc), ("reg", outcome_model)])
1083            import warnings
1084            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1085                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1086                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1087                    predictions = cross_val_predict(pipeline, X, y, cv=cv)
1088        
1089        self._outcome_predictions = predictions
1090        
1091        # Train a final model on the full dataset for SHAP computation
1092        if isinstance(outcome_model, CatBoostRegressor):
1093            # Apply preprocessing to full dataset
1094            X_full_prep = preproc.fit_transform(X)
1095            
1096            # Create and train final model
1097            final_model = CatBoostRegressor(
1098                thread_count=-1,
1099                random_seed=self.random_state,
1100                verbose=False
1101            )
1102            
1103            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1104                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1105                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1106                    final_model.fit(X_full_prep, y)
1107            
1108            # Store the trained model and data needed for SHAP computation
1109            self._outcome_fitted_model = final_model
1110            self._outcome_feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
1111            self._outcome_X_for_shap = X_full_prep  # Store preprocessed data for SHAP
1112        else:
1113            # For non-CatBoost models, fit the pipeline on full data
1114            pipeline = Pipeline([("prep", preproc), ("reg", outcome_model)])
1115            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1116                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1117                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1118                    pipeline.fit(X, y)
1119            self._outcome_fitted_model = pipeline
1120            self._outcome_feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
1121        
1122        # Create and return OutcomeModel instance
1123        return OutcomeModel(
1124            predicted_outcomes=predictions,
1125            actual_outcomes=y,
1126            fitted_model=self._outcome_fitted_model,
1127            feature_names=self._outcome_feature_names,
1128            X_for_shap=getattr(self, '_outcome_X_for_shap', None)
1129        )
1130
1131    def auc_m(self, m: Optional[np.ndarray] = None) -> float:
1132        """Compute ROC AUC of treatment assignment vs. m(x)."""
1133        if m is None:
1134            m = getattr(self, "_m", None)
1135            if m is None:
1136                pm = self.fit_m()
1137                m = pm.m
1138        t = self.d.df[self.d.treatment].astype(int).values
1139        return float(roc_auc_score(t, m))
1140
1141    def positivity_check_m(self, m: Optional[np.ndarray] = None, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (0.05, 0.95)) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1142        """Check overlap/positivity for m(x) based on thresholds."""
1143        if m is None:
1144            m = getattr(self, "_m", None)
1145            if m is None:
1146                pm = self.fit_m()
1147                m = pm.m
1148        low, high = bounds
1149        return {
1150            "bounds": bounds,
1151            "share_below": float((m < low).mean()),
1152            "share_above": float((m > high).mean()),
1153            "flag": bool(((m < low).mean() + (m > high).mean()) > 0.02),
1154        }
1155
1156    def plot_m_overlap(self, m: Optional[np.ndarray] = None):
1157        """Plot overlaid histograms of m(x) for treated vs control."""
1158        if m is None:
1159            m = getattr(self, "_m", None)
1160            if m is None:
1161                pm = self.fit_m()
1162                m = pm.m
1163        df = self.d.df
1164        t = df[self.d.treatment].astype(int).values
1165        fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1166        ax.hist(m[t == 1], bins=30, alpha=0.5, density=True, label="treated")
1167        ax.hist(m[t == 0], bins=30, alpha=0.5, density=True, label="control")
1168        ax.set_xlabel("m(x) = P(D=1|X)")
1169        ax.set_ylabel("Density")
1170        ax.legend()
1171        ax.set_title("Overlap of m(x)")
1172        return fig
1173
1174    # Back-compat shims for public API
1175    def confounders_roc_auc(self, ps: Optional[np.ndarray] = None) -> float:
1176        _warn_once("confounders_roc_auc()", "auc_m()")
1177        return self.auc_m(m=ps)
1178
1179    def positivity_check(self, ps: Optional[np.ndarray] = None, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (0.05, 0.95)) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1180        _warn_once("positivity_check()", "positivity_check_m()")
1181        return self.positivity_check_m(m=ps, bounds=bounds)
1182
1183    def plot_ps_overlap(self, ps: Optional[np.ndarray] = None):
1184        _warn_once("plot_ps_overlap()", "plot_m_overlap()")
1185        return self.plot_m_overlap(m=ps)
