1187    # ---------- balance ----------
1188
1189    def confounders_means(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1190        """Comprehensive confounders balance assessment with means by treatment group.
1191
1192        Returns a DataFrame with detailed balance information including:
1193        - Mean values of each confounder for control group (treatment=0)
1194        - Mean values of each confounder for treated group (treatment=1)
1195        - Absolute difference between treatment groups
1196        - Standardized Mean Difference (SMD) for formal balance assessment
1197        - Kolmogorov–Smirnov statistic (ks) and p-value (ks_pvalue) for distributional differences
1198        
1199        This method provides a comprehensive view of confounder balance by showing
1200        the actual mean values alongside the standardized differences, making it easier
1201        to understand both the magnitude and direction of imbalances.
1202
1203        Returns
1204        -------
1205        pd.DataFrame
1206            DataFrame with confounders as index and the following columns:
1207            - mean_t_0: mean value for control group (treatment=0)
1208            - mean_t_1: mean value for treated group (treatment=1)  
1209            - abs_diff: absolute difference abs(mean_t_1 - mean_t_0)
1210            - smd: standardized mean difference (Cohen's d)
1211            - ks: Kolmogorov–Smirnov statistic
1212            - ks_pvalue: p-value of the KS test
1213            
1214        Notes
1215        -----
1216        SMD values > 0.1 in absolute value typically indicate meaningful imbalance.
1217        Categorical variables are automatically converted to dummy variables.
1218        
1219        Examples
1220        --------
1221        >>> eda = CausalEDA(causal_data)
1222        >>> balance = eda.confounders_means()
1223        >>> print(balance.head())
1224                     mean_t_0  mean_t_1  abs_diff       smd
1225        confounders                                       
1226        age              29.5      31.2      1.7     0.085
1227        income        45000.0   47500.0   2500.0     0.125
1228        education         0.25      0.35      0.1     0.215
1229        """
1230        # Delegate implementation to dedicated balance module for reuse and testing
1231        from .confounders_balance import confounders_balance
1232        return confounders_balance(
1233            df=self.d.df,
1234            treatment=self.d.treatment,
1235            confounders=self.d.confounders,
1236        )
1237
1238    from typing import Optional, Tuple
1239
1240    def outcome_hist(
1241            self,
1242            treatment: Optional[str] = None,
1243            outcome: Optional[str] = None,
1244            bins="fd",  # smarter default (still accepts int)
1245            density: bool = True,
1246            alpha: float = 0.45,
1247            sharex: bool = True,
1248            kde: bool = True,  # overlay smooth density (SciPy-free)
1249            clip: Optional[Tuple[float, float]] = (0.01, 0.99),  # trim tails for nicer view
1250            figsize: Tuple[float, float] = (9, 5.5),
1251            dpi: int = 220,
1252            font_scale: float = 1.15,
1253            save: Optional[str] = None,  # "outcome.png" / ".svg" / ".pdf"
1254            save_dpi: Optional[int] = None,
1255            transparent: bool = False,
1256    ):
1257        """
1258        Plot the distribution of the outcome for each treatment on a single, pretty plot.
1259
1260        Features
1261        --------
1262        - High-DPI canvas + scalable fonts
1263        - Default Matplotlib colors; KDE & mean lines match their histogram colors
1264        - Numeric outcomes: shared x-range (optional), optional KDE, quantile clipping
1265        - Categorical outcomes: normalized grouped bars by treatment
1266        - Optional hi-res export (PNG/SVG/PDF)
1267        """
1268        import numpy as np
1269        import pandas as pd
1270        import matplotlib as mpl
1271        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
1272
1273        # ---------- Helpers -----------------------------------------------------
1274        def _silverman_bandwidth(x: np.ndarray) -> float:
1275            x = np.asarray(x, float)
1276            n = x.size
1277            if n < 2:
1278                return 0.04
1279            sd = np.std(x, ddof=1)
1280            iqr = np.subtract(*np.percentile(x, [75, 25]))
1281            s = sd if iqr <= 0 else min(sd, iqr / 1.34)
1282            h = 0.9 * s * n ** (-1 / 5)
1283            return float(max(h, 1e-6))
1284
1285        def _kde_unbounded(x: np.ndarray, xs: np.ndarray, h: float) -> np.ndarray:
1286            """
1287            Gaussian KDE on R, implemented with NumPy (no SciPy).
1288            Handles degenerate cases by drawing a small bump at the mean.
1289            """
1290            x = np.asarray(x, float)
1291            if x.size == 0:
1292                return np.zeros_like(xs)
1293            if x.size < 2 or np.std(x) < 1e-12:
1294                mu = float(np.mean(x)) if x.size else 0.0
1295                h0 = max(h, 1e-3)
1296                z = (xs - mu) / h0
1297                return np.exp(-0.5 * z ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h0)
1298            diff = (xs[None, :] - x[:, None]) / h
1299            kern = np.exp(-0.5 * diff ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h)
1300            return kern.mean(axis=0)
1301
1302        def _first_patch_color(patches, fallback):
1303            for p in patches:
1304                fc = p.get_facecolor()
1305                if fc is not None:
1306                    return fc
1307            return fallback
1308
1309        # ---------- Data & columns ---------------------------------------------
1310        df = self.d.df
1311        t_col = treatment or self.d.treatment
1312        y_col = outcome or self.d.outcome
1313        if t_col not in df.columns or y_col not in df.columns:
1314            raise ValueError("Specified treatment/outcome columns not found in DataFrame.")
1315
1316        treatments = pd.unique(df[t_col])  # preserves input order
1317        # Filter rows with valid outcome & treatment
1318        valid = df[[t_col, y_col]].dropna()
1319        if valid.empty:
1320            raise ValueError("No non-missing values for the selected treatment/outcome.")
1321
1322        # ---------- Figure with high DPI & scaled fonts ------------------------
1323        rc = {
1324            "font.size": 11 * font_scale,
1325            "axes.titlesize": 13 * font_scale,
1326            "axes.labelsize": 12 * font_scale,
1327            "legend.fontsize": 10 * font_scale,
1328            "xtick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
1329            "ytick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
1330        }
1331        with mpl.rc_context(rc):
1332            fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=figsize, dpi=dpi)
1333
1334            # ---------- Branch: categorical vs numeric -------------------------
1335            if not pd.api.types.is_numeric_dtype(valid[y_col]):
1336                # CATEGORICAL: normalized grouped bars
1337                vals = pd.unique(valid[y_col])
1338                # Stable, readable category order
1339                vals_sorted = sorted(vals, key=lambda v: (str(type(v)), str(v)))
1340                width = 0.8 / max(1, len(treatments))
1341                x = np.arange(len(vals_sorted))
1342
1343                # Color cycle
1344                cycle = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key().get("color", ["C0", "C1", "C2", "C3"])
1345
1346                for i, tr in enumerate(treatments):
1347                    sub = valid.loc[valid[t_col] == tr, y_col]
1348                    counts = sub.value_counts(normalize=True)
1349                    heights = [float(counts.get(v, 0.0)) for v in vals_sorted]
1350                    ax.bar(x + i * width, heights, width=width, alpha=alpha,
1351                           label=f"{tr} (n={sub.shape[0]})",
1352                           color=cycle[i % len(cycle)],
1353                           edgecolor="white", linewidth=0.6)
1354
1355                ax.set_xticks(x + (len(treatments) - 1) * width / 2)
1356                ax.set_xticklabels([str(v) for v in vals_sorted])
1357                ax.set_ylabel("Proportion")
1358                ax.set_xlabel(str(y_col))
1359                ax.set_title("Outcome distribution by treatment (categorical)")
1360                ax.grid(True, axis="y", linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
1361                for spine in ("top", "right"):
1362                    ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)
1363                ax.legend(title=str(t_col), frameon=False)
1364                fig.tight_layout()
1365
1366            else:
1367                # NUMERIC: overlay histograms (+ optional KDE) per treatment
1368                y_all = valid[y_col].to_numpy()
1369
1370                # Shared x-limits for all treatments if requested
1371                if sharex:
1372                    if clip:
1373                        lo, hi = np.quantile(y_all, [clip[0], clip[1]])
1374                    else:
1375                        lo, hi = np.nanmin(y_all), np.nanmax(y_all)
1376                    if not np.isfinite(lo) or not np.isfinite(hi) or hi <= lo:
1377                        lo, hi = float(np.nanmin(y_all)), float(np.nanmax(y_all))
1378                    hist_range = (float(lo), float(hi))
1379                    ax.set_xlim(*hist_range)
1380                else:
1381                    hist_range = None  # each call to hist will expand limits as needed
1382
1383                # Keep track of colors actually used so KDE/means match
1384                cycle = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key().get("color", ["C0", "C1", "C2", "C3"])
1385                used_colors = {}
1386
1387                # Draw hists
1388                for i, tr in enumerate(treatments):
1389                    y_vals = valid.loc[valid[t_col] == tr, y_col].to_numpy()
1390                    y_vals = y_vals[np.isfinite(y_vals)]
1391                    if y_vals.size == 0:
1392                        continue
1393
1394                    h = ax.hist(
1395                        y_vals,
1396                        bins=bins,
1397                        density=density,
1398                        alpha=alpha,
1399                        label=f"{tr} (n={y_vals.size})",
1400                        range=hist_range,
1401                        edgecolor="white",
1402                        linewidth=0.6,
1403                        color=None,  # let Matplotlib choose
1404                    )
1405                    color_this = _first_patch_color(h[2], cycle[i % len(cycle)])
1406                    used_colors[tr] = color_this
1407
1408                # KDE overlays (SciPy-free, stable)
1409                if kde and len(used_colors) > 0:
1410                    # Build a common grid for smooth lines
1411                    if hist_range is None:
1412                        # Determine from all numeric values (optionally clipped)
1413                        if clip:
1414                            lo, hi = np.quantile(y_all, [clip[0], clip[1]])
1415                        else:
1416                            lo, hi = np.nanmin(y_all), np.nanmax(y_all)
1417                        if not np.isfinite(lo) or not np.isfinite(hi) or hi <= lo:
1418                            lo, hi = float(np.nanmin(y_all)), float(np.nanmax(y_all))
1419                    else:
1420                        lo, hi = hist_range
1421
1422                    xs = np.linspace(float(lo), float(hi), 800)
1423
1424                    for tr in treatments:
1425                        if tr not in used_colors:
1426                            continue
1427                        y_vals = valid.loc[valid[t_col] == tr, y_col].to_numpy()
1428                        y_vals = y_vals[np.isfinite(y_vals)]
1429                        if y_vals.size == 0:
1430                            continue
1431                        hbw = _silverman_bandwidth(y_vals)
1432                        dens = _kde_unbounded(y_vals, xs, hbw)
1433                        # If histogram is counts, scale KDE area roughly to counts for visual parity
1434                        if not density:
1435                            # approximate scaling by total count and bin width near midrange
1436                            bw = (hi - lo) / (bins if isinstance(bins, int) else 30)
1437                            dens = dens * y_vals.size * bw
1438                        ax.plot(xs, dens, linewidth=2.2, color=used_colors[tr],
1439                                label=f"{tr} (KDE)")
1440
1441                # Mean lines
1442                for tr in treatments:
1443                    y_vals = valid.loc[valid[t_col] == tr, y_col].to_numpy()
1444                    y_vals = y_vals[np.isfinite(y_vals)]
1445                    if y_vals.size == 0:
1446                        continue
1447                    mu = float(np.mean(y_vals))
1448                    # Clamp mean line to visible range if sharex & clipped
1449                    if sharex and hist_range is not None:
1450                        mu = float(np.clip(mu, hist_range[0], hist_range[1]))
1451                    ax.axvline(mu, linestyle=":", linewidth=1.8,
1452                               color=used_colors.get(tr, "k"), alpha=0.95)
1453
1454                ax.set_xlabel(str(y_col))
1455                ax.set_ylabel("Density" if density else "Count")
1456                ax.set_title("Outcome distribution by treatment")
1457                ax.grid(True, linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
1458                for spine in ("top", "right"):
1459                    ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)
1460                ax.legend(title=str(t_col), frameon=False)
1461                fig.tight_layout()
1462
1463            # -------- Optional high-res save -----------------------------------
1464            if save is not None:
1465                ext = str(save).lower().split(".")[-1]
1466                _dpi = save_dpi or (300 if ext in {"png", "jpg", "jpeg", "tif", "tiff"} else dpi)
1467                fig.savefig(
1468                    save,
1469                    dpi=_dpi,
1470                    bbox_inches="tight",
1471                    pad_inches=0.1,
1472                    transparent=transparent,
1473                    facecolor="none" if transparent else "white",
1474                )
1475
1476        plt.close(fig)
1477        return fig
1478
1479    from typing import Optional, Tuple
1480
1481    def outcome_boxplot(
1482            self,
1483            treatment: Optional[str] = None,
1484            outcome: Optional[str] = None,
1485            figsize: Tuple[float, float] = (9, 5.5),
1486            dpi: int = 220,
1487            font_scale: float = 1.15,
1488            showfliers: bool = True,
1489            patch_artist: bool = True,
1490            save: Optional[str] = None,  # "boxplot.png" / ".svg" / ".pdf"
1491            save_dpi: Optional[int] = None,
1492            transparent: bool = False,
1493    ):
1494        """
1495        Prettified boxplot of the outcome by treatment.
1496
1497        Features
1498        --------
1499        - High-DPI figure, scalable fonts
1500        - Soft modern color styling (default Matplotlib palette)
1501        - Optional outliers, gentle transparency
1502        - Optional save to PNG/SVG/PDF
1503        """
1504        import numpy as np
1505        import pandas as pd
1506        import matplotlib as mpl
1507        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
1508
1509        # --- Data setup --------------------------------------------------------
1510        df = self.d.df
1511        t_col = treatment or self.d.treatment
1512        y_col = outcome or self.d.outcome
1513
1514        if t_col not in df.columns or y_col not in df.columns:
1515            raise ValueError("Specified treatment/outcome columns not found in DataFrame.")
1516
1517        # Drop rows with missing outcome
1518        df_valid = df[[t_col, y_col]].dropna()
1519        if df_valid.empty:
1520            raise ValueError("No valid rows with both treatment and outcome present.")
1521
1522        treatments = pd.unique(df_valid[t_col])
1523        data = [df_valid.loc[df_valid[t_col] == tr, y_col].values for tr in treatments]
1524
1525        # --- Matplotlib rc settings --------------------------------------------
1526        rc = {
1527            "font.size": 11 * font_scale,
1528            "axes.titlesize": 13 * font_scale,
1529            "axes.labelsize": 12 * font_scale,
1530            "legend.fontsize": 10 * font_scale,
1531            "xtick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
1532            "ytick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
1533        }
1534
1535        with mpl.rc_context(rc):
1536            fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=figsize, dpi=dpi)
1537
1538            # Use Matplotlib default color cycle
1539            cycle = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key().get("color", ["C0", "C1", "C2", "C3"])
1540            colors = [cycle[i % len(cycle)] for i in range(len(treatments))]
1541
1542            # --- Draw boxplot ---------------------------------------------------
1543            bp = ax.boxplot(
1544                data,
1545                patch_artist=patch_artist,
1546                labels=[str(tr) for tr in treatments],
1547                showfliers=showfliers,
1548                boxprops=dict(linewidth=1.1, alpha=0.8),
1549                whiskerprops=dict(linewidth=1.0, alpha=0.8),
1550                capprops=dict(linewidth=1.0, alpha=0.8),
1551                medianprops=dict(linewidth=2.0, color="black"),
1552                flierprops=dict(
1553                    marker="o",
1554                    markersize=4,
1555                    markerfacecolor="grey",
1556                    alpha=0.6,
1557                    markeredgewidth=0.3,
1558                ),
1559            )
1560
1561            # --- Colorize boxes with soft fill ---------------------------------
1562            if patch_artist:
1563                for patch, color in zip(bp["boxes"], colors):
1564                    patch.set_facecolor(color)
1565                    patch.set_alpha(0.35)
1566                    patch.set_edgecolor(color)
1567
1568            # --- Titles and cosmetics ------------------------------------------
1569            ax.set_xlabel(str(t_col))
1570            ax.set_ylabel(str(y_col))
1571            ax.set_title("Outcome by treatment (boxplot)")
1572            ax.grid(True, axis="y", linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
1573            for spine in ("top", "right"):
1574                ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)
1575            fig.tight_layout()
1576
1577            # --- Optional save -------------------------------------------------
1578            if save is not None:
1579                ext = str(save).lower().split(".")[-1]
1580                _dpi = save_dpi or (300 if ext in {"png", "jpg", "jpeg", "tif", "tiff"} else dpi)
1581                fig.savefig(
1582                    save,
1583                    dpi=_dpi,
1584                    bbox_inches="tight",
1585                    pad_inches=0.1,
1586                    transparent=transparent,
1587                    facecolor="none" if transparent else "white",
1588                )
1589
1590        return fig
1591
1592    def outcome_plots(self,
1593                      treatment: Optional[str] = None,
1594                      outcome: Optional[str] = None,
1595                      bins: int = 30,
1596                      density: bool = True,
1597                      alpha: float = 0.5,
1598                      figsize: Tuple[float, float] = (7, 4),
1599                      sharex: bool = True) -> Tuple[plt.Figure, plt.Figure]:
1600        """
1601        Plot the distribution of the outcome for every treatment on one plot,
1602        and also produce a boxplot by treatment to visualize outliers.
1603
1604        Parameters
1605        ----------
1606        treatment : Optional[str]
1607            Treatment column name. Defaults to the treatment stored in the CausalEDA data.
1608        outcome : Optional[str]
1609            Outcome column name. Defaults to the outcome stored in the CausalEDA data.
1610        bins : int
1611            Number of bins for histograms when the outcome is numeric.
1612        density : bool
1613            Whether to normalize histograms to form a density.
1614        alpha : float
1615            Transparency for overlaid histograms.
1616        figsize : tuple
1617            Figure size for the plots.
1618        sharex : bool
1619            If True and the outcome is numeric, use the same x-limits across treatments.
1620
1621        Returns
1622        -------
1623        Tuple[matplotlib.figure.Figure, matplotlib.figure.Figure]
1624            (fig_distribution, fig_boxplot)
1625        """
1626        fig_hist = self.outcome_hist(
1627            treatment=treatment,
1628            outcome=outcome,
1629            bins=bins,
1630            density=density,
1631            alpha=alpha,
1632            figsize=figsize,
1633            sharex=sharex,
1634        )
1635        fig_box = self.outcome_boxplot(
1636            treatment=treatment,
1637            outcome=outcome,
1638            figsize=figsize,
1639        )
1640        return fig_hist, fig_box
1641
1642    def m_features(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1643        """Return feature attribution from the fitted m(x) model.
1644        
1645        - CatBoost path: SHAP attributions with columns 'shap_mean' and 'shap_mean_abs',
1646          sorted by 'shap_mean_abs'. Uses transformed feature names from the preprocessor.
1647        - Sklearn path (LogisticRegression): absolute coefficients reported as 'coef_abs'.
1648        """
1649        # Check if model has been fitted
1650        if not hasattr(self, '_fitted_model') or self._fitted_model is None:
1651            raise RuntimeError("No fitted propensity model found. Please call fit_m() first.")
1652        if not hasattr(self, '_feature_names') or self._feature_names is None:
1653            raise RuntimeError("Feature names not available. Please call fit_m() first.")
1654        
1655        if isinstance(self._fitted_model, CatBoostClassifier):
1656            try:
1657                from catboost import Pool
1658                if not hasattr(self, '_X_for_shap') or self._X_for_shap is None:
1659                    raise RuntimeError("Preprocessed data for SHAP computation not available. Please call fit_m() first.")
1660                shap_pool = Pool(data=self._X_for_shap)
1661                shap_values = self._fitted_model.get_feature_importance(type='ShapValues', data=shap_pool)
1662                shap_values_no_bias = shap_values[:, :-1]
1663                shap_mean = np.mean(shap_values_no_bias, axis=0)
1664                shap_mean_abs = np.mean(np.abs(shap_values_no_bias), axis=0)
1665                feature_names = list(self._feature_names)
1666                if len(feature_names) != shap_values_no_bias.shape[1]:
1667                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match SHAP values. Ensure transformed names are used.")
1668                # Adjust shap_mean to have magnitude equal to shap_mean_abs while preserving sign
1669                shap_mean_signed = np.sign(shap_mean) * shap_mean_abs
1670                result_df = pd.DataFrame({
1671                    'feature': feature_names,
1672                    'shap_mean': shap_mean_signed,
1673                    'shap_mean_abs': shap_mean_abs,
1674                })
1675                # Sort by shap_mean_abs (magnitude) descending for determinism
1676                result_df = result_df.sort_values('shap_mean_abs', ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)
1677                # Strip ColumnTransformer/pipeline prefixes like 'num__' or 'cat__' for readability
1678                try:
1679                    result_df['feature'] = result_df['feature'].astype(str).str.replace(r'^[^_]+__', '', regex=True)
1680                except Exception:
1681                    pass
1682                # Augment with probability-scale metrics using baseline p0 = mean m
1683                p0 = float(np.mean(getattr(self, '_m', None))) if hasattr(self, '_m') else np.nan
1684                if not np.isfinite(p0):
1685                    raise RuntimeError("Baseline m estimates not available to compute probability-based columns. Fit m first.")
1686                p0 = float(np.clip(p0, 1e-9, 1 - 1e-9))
1687                logit_p0 = float(np.log(p0 / (1.0 - p0)))
1688                result_df['odds_mult_abs'] = np.exp(result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values)
1689                result_df['exact_pp_change_abs'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values))) - p0
1690                result_df['exact_pp_change_signed'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean'].values))) - p0
1691                return result_df
1692            except Exception as e:
1693                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract SHAP values from CatBoost model: {e}")
1694        elif hasattr(self._fitted_model, 'named_steps') and hasattr(self._fitted_model.named_steps.get('clf'), 'coef_'):
1695            try:
1696                clf = self._fitted_model.named_steps['clf']
1697                coef_abs = np.abs(clf.coef_[0])
1698                prep = self._fitted_model.named_steps.get('prep')
1699                if hasattr(prep, 'get_feature_names_out'):
1700                    try:
1701                        feature_names = [str(n) for n in prep.get_feature_names_out()]
1702                    except Exception:
1703                        feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
1704                else:
1705                    feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
1706                if len(coef_abs) != len(feature_names):
1707                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match coefficients.")
1708                df = pd.DataFrame({'feature': feature_names, 'importance': coef_abs, 'coef_abs': coef_abs})
1709                # Strip ColumnTransformer/pipeline prefixes like 'num__' or 'cat__' for readability
1710                try:
1711                    df['feature'] = df['feature'].astype(str).str.replace(r'^[^_]+__', '', regex=True)
1712                except Exception:
1713                    pass
1714                df = df.sort_values('importance', ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)
1715                return df
1716            except Exception as e:
1717                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract feature importance from sklearn model: {e}")
1718        else:
1719            raise RuntimeError(f"Feature importance extraction not supported for model type: {type(self._fitted_model)}")
1720
1721    # Back-compat shim
1722    def treatment_features(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1723        _warn_once("treatment_features()", "m_features()")
1724        return self.m_features()
class PropensityModel: 
 58class PropensityModel:
 59    """A model for m(x) = P(D=1|X) and related diagnostics.
 60    
 61    This class encapsulates propensity m and provides methods for:
 62    - Computing ROC AUC (AUC of D vs m)
 63    - Extracting SHAP values
 64    - Plotting m overlap
 65    - Checking positivity/overlap
 66    
 67    The class is returned by CausalEDA.fit_m() and provides a cleaner
 68    interface for propensity analysis.
 69    """
 70    
 71    def __init__(self, 
 72                 m: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
 73                 d: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
 74                 fitted_model: Any = None,
 75                 feature_names: List[str] = None,
 76                 X_for_shap: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
 77                 cat_features_for_shap: Optional[List[int]] = None,
 78                 propensity_scores: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
 79                 treatment_values: Optional[np.ndarray] = None):
 80        """Initialize PropensityModel with fitted model artifacts.
 81        
 82        Parameters
 83        ----------
 84        m : np.ndarray
 85            Array of m(x) = P(D=1|X)
 86        d : np.ndarray
 87            Array of actual treatment assignments (0/1)
 88        fitted_model : Any
 89            The fitted propensity model
 90        feature_names : List[str]
 91            Names of features used in the model
 92        X_for_shap : Optional[np.ndarray]
 93            Preprocessed feature matrix for SHAP computation
 94        cat_features_for_shap : Optional[List[int]]
 95            Categorical feature indices for SHAP computation
 96        propensity_scores, treatment_values : Optional legacy aliases accepted for back-compat
 97        """
 98        # Back-compat arg names
 99        if m is None and propensity_scores is not None:
100            _warn_once("propensity_scores (init)", "m")
101            m = propensity_scores
102        if d is None and treatment_values is not None:
103            d = treatment_values
104        self.m = np.asarray(m) if m is not None else None
105        self.d = np.asarray(d) if d is not None else None
106        self.fitted_model = fitted_model
107        self.feature_names = feature_names
108        self.X_for_shap = X_for_shap
109        self.cat_features_for_shap = cat_features_for_shap
110
111    @classmethod
112    def from_kfold(
113        cls,
114        X: pd.DataFrame,
115        t: np.ndarray,
116        model: Optional[Any] = None,
117        n_splits: int = 5,
118        random_state: int = 42,
119        preprocessor: Optional[ColumnTransformer] = None,
120    ) -> "PropensityModel":
121        """Estimate m(x) via K-fold and return a PropensityModel.
122
123        Produces out-of-fold m estimates using StratifiedKFold. If no
124        model is provided, a fast LogisticRegression is used. Categorical
125        features are one-hot encoded and numeric features standardized by
126        default using a ColumnTransformer.
127        """
128        # Ensure inputs are aligned
129        if isinstance(X, pd.DataFrame):
130            feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
131        else:
132            raise ValueError("X must be a pandas DataFrame with named columns.")
133        t = np.asarray(t).astype(int)
134        # validate binary treatment
135        if not np.isin(t, [0, 1]).all():
136            raise ValueError("Treatment must be binary {0,1}.")
137
138        # Preprocessor default
139        if preprocessor is None:
140            num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
141            cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
142            num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))])
143            preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
144                transformers=[
145                    ("num", num_transformer, num),
146                    ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
147                ],
148                remainder="drop",
149            )
150
151        # Model default
152        if model is None:
153            model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=1000)
154
155        cv = StratifiedKFold(n_splits=n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=random_state)
156
157        # Compute out-of-fold probabilities
158        if isinstance(model, CatBoostClassifier):
159            import warnings
160            ps = np.zeros(len(X))
161            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
162                with warnings.catch_warnings():
163                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
164                    for tr_idx, te_idx in cv.split(X, t):
165                        X_tr, X_te = X.iloc[tr_idx], X.iloc[te_idx]
166                        t_tr = t[tr_idx]
167                        X_tr_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_tr)
168                        X_te_p = preprocessor.transform(X_te)
169                        fold_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
170                        fold_model.fit(X_tr_p, t_tr)
171                        ps[te_idx] = fold_model.predict_proba(X_te_p)[:, 1]
172            # Fit final model for SHAP
173            X_full_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X)
174            final_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_state=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
175            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
176                final_model.fit(X_full_p, t)
177            X_for_shap = X_full_p
178            fitted = final_model
179            # use transformed feature names for SHAP alignment
180            try:
181                feature_names = preprocessor.get_feature_names_out().tolist()
182            except Exception:
183                feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(X_full_p.shape[1])]
184        else:
185            pipe = Pipeline([("prep", preprocessor), ("clf", model)])
186            import warnings
187            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
188                with warnings.catch_warnings():
189                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
190                    ps = cross_val_predict(pipe, X, t, cv=cv, method="predict_proba")[:, 1]
191                    pipe.fit(X, t)
192            fitted = pipe
193            X_for_shap = None
194
195        # clip for stability
196        ps = np.clip(ps, 1e-6, 1 - 1e-6)
197
198        return cls(
199            propensity_scores=ps,
200            treatment_values=t,
201            fitted_model=fitted,
202            feature_names=feature_names,
203            X_for_shap=X_for_shap,
204        )
205    
206    @property
207    def roc_auc(self) -> float:
208        """Compute ROC AUC of treatment assignment vs. m(x).
209        
210        Higher AUC means treatment is more predictable from confounders,
211        indicating stronger systematic differences between groups (potential
212        cofounding). Values near 0.5 suggest random-like assignment.
213        
214        Returns
215        -------
216        float
217            ROC AUC score between 0 and 1
218        """
219        return float(roc_auc_score(self.d, self.m))
220    
221    @property
222    def shap(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
223        """Return feature attribution from the fitted propensity model.
224        
225        For CatBoost models: returns SHAP-based attributions with both signed mean (shap_mean)
226        and magnitude (shap_mean_abs), sorted by shap_mean_abs.
227        
228        For sklearn linear models (LogisticRegression): returns absolute coefficients under
229        column 'coef_abs' (not SHAP), sorted descending.
230        """
231        # Extract SHAP values or feature importance based on model type
232        if isinstance(self.fitted_model, CatBoostClassifier):
233            try:
234                from catboost import Pool
235                if self.X_for_shap is None:
236                    raise RuntimeError("Preprocessed data for SHAP computation not available.")
237                shap_pool = Pool(data=self.X_for_shap)
238                shap_values = self.fitted_model.get_feature_importance(type='ShapValues', data=shap_pool)
239                shap_values_no_bias = shap_values[:, :-1]
240                shap_mean = np.mean(shap_values_no_bias, axis=0)
241                shap_mean_abs = np.mean(np.abs(shap_values_no_bias), axis=0)
242                feature_names = list(self.feature_names)
243                if len(feature_names) != shap_values_no_bias.shape[1]:
244                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match SHAP values. Ensure transformed names are used.")
245                result_df = pd.DataFrame({
246                    'feature': feature_names,
247                    'shap_mean': shap_mean,
248                    'shap_mean_abs': shap_mean_abs,
249                })
250                # Sort by absolute shap_mean (test expects this order)
251                result_df['abs_shap_mean'] = np.abs(result_df['shap_mean'].values)
252                result_df = result_df.sort_values('abs_shap_mean', ascending=False).drop(columns=['abs_shap_mean']).reset_index(drop=True)
253                # Augment with probability-scale metrics using baseline p0 = mean propensity score
254                p0 = float(np.mean(self.propensity_scores))
255                p0 = float(np.clip(p0, 1e-9, 1 - 1e-9))
256                logit_p0 = float(np.log(p0 / (1.0 - p0)))
257                # result_df['odds_mult_abs'] = np.exp(result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values)
258                result_df['exact_pp_change_abs'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values))) - p0
259                result_df['exact_pp_change_signed'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean'].values))) - p0
260                return result_df
261            except Exception as e:
262                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract SHAP values from CatBoost model: {e}")
263        elif hasattr(self.fitted_model, 'named_steps') and hasattr(self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('clf'), 'coef_'):
264            try:
265                clf = self.fitted_model.named_steps['clf']
266                coef_abs = np.abs(clf.coef_[0])
267                prep = self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('prep')
268                if hasattr(prep, 'get_feature_names_out'):
269                    try:
270                        feature_names = [str(n) for n in prep.get_feature_names_out()]
271                    except Exception:
272                        feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
273                else:
274                    feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
275                if len(coef_abs) != len(feature_names):
276                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match coefficients.")
277                df = pd.DataFrame({'feature': feature_names, 'importance': coef_abs, 'coef_abs': coef_abs}).sort_values('importance', ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)
278                return df
279            except Exception as e:
280                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract feature importance from sklearn model: {e}")
281        else:
282            raise RuntimeError(f"Feature importance extraction not supported for model type: {type(self.fitted_model)}")
283    
284    @property
285    def propensity_scores(self):
286        _warn_once("propensity_scores", "m")
287        return self.m
288
289    def plot_m_overlap(
290            self,
291            clip=(0.01, 0.99),
292            bins="fd",
293            kde=True,
294            shade_overlap=True,
295            ax=None,
296            figsize=(9, 5.5),
297            dpi=220,
298            font_scale=1.15,
299            save=None,
300            save_dpi=None,
301            transparent=False,
302            color_t=None,  # None -> use Matplotlib defaults
303            color_c=None,  # None -> use Matplotlib defaults
304    ):
305        """
306        Overlap plot for m(x)=P(D=1|X) with high-res rendering.
307        - x in [0,1]
308        - Stable NumPy KDE w/ boundary reflection (no SciPy warnings)
309        - Uses Matplotlib default colors unless color_t/color_c are provided
310        """
311        import numpy as np
312        import matplotlib as mpl
313        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
314
315        # ------- Helpers --------------------------------------------------------
316        def _silverman_bandwidth(x):
317            x = np.asarray(x, float)
318            n = x.size
319            if n < 2:
320                return 0.04
321            sd = np.std(x, ddof=1)
322            iqr = np.subtract(*np.percentile(x, [75, 25]))
323            s = sd if iqr <= 0 else min(sd, iqr / 1.34)
324            h = 0.9 * s * n ** (-1 / 5)
325            return float(max(h, 0.02))
326
327        def _kde_reflect(x, xs, h):
328            x = np.asarray(x, float)
329            if x.size == 0:
330                return np.zeros_like(xs)
331            if x.size < 2 or np.std(x) < 1e-8:
332                mu = float(np.mean(x)) if x.size else 0.5
333                h0 = max(h, 0.02)
334                z = (xs - mu) / h0
335                return np.exp(-0.5 * z ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h0)
336            xr = np.concatenate([x, -x, 2 - x])  # reflect at 0 and 1
337            diff = (xs[None, :] - xr[:, None]) / h
338            kern = np.exp(-0.5 * diff ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h)
339            return kern.mean(axis=0)
340
341        def _patch_color(patches, fallback):
342            # Grab facecolor from the first bar; fallback to cycle color if needed
343            for p in patches:
344                fc = p.get_facecolor()
345                if fc is not None:
346                    return fc  # RGBA
347            return fallback
348
349        # ------- Data -----------------------------------------------------------
350        d = np.asarray(self.d).astype(int)
351        m = np.asarray(self.m, dtype=float)
352        mask = np.isfinite(m) & np.isfinite(d)
353        d, m = d[mask], m[mask]
354        mt = m[d == 1]
355        mc = m[d == 0]
356        if mt.size == 0 or mc.size == 0:
357            raise ValueError("Both treated and control must have at least one observation after cleaning.")
358
359        # Clamp to [0,1] to keep plot stable and inside bounds
360        mtp = np.clip(mt, 0.0, 1.0)
361        mcp = np.clip(mc, 0.0, 1.0)
362
363        # ------- Figure/axes with high DPI & scaled fonts ----------------------
364        rc = {
365            "font.size": 11 * font_scale,
366            "axes.titlesize": 13 * font_scale,
367            "axes.labelsize": 12 * font_scale,
368            "legend.fontsize": 10 * font_scale,
369            "xtick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
370            "ytick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
371        }
372        with mpl.rc_context(rc):
373            if ax is None:
374                fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=figsize, dpi=dpi)
375            else:
376                fig = ax.figure
377                try:
378                    fig.set_dpi(dpi)
379                except Exception:
380                    pass
381
382            # ------- Histograms (ALWAYS [0,1]) ---------------------------------
383            ht = ax.hist(mtp, bins=bins, range=(0.0, 1.0), density=True,
384                         alpha=0.45, label=f"Treated (n={mt.size})",
385                         edgecolor="white", linewidth=0.6,
386                         color=color_t)  # None -> default color
387            hc = ax.hist(mcp, bins=bins, range=(0.0, 1.0), density=True,
388                         alpha=0.45, label=f"Control (n={mc.size})",
389                         edgecolor="white", linewidth=0.6,
390                         color=color_c)  # None -> default color
391
392            # Determine the actual colors used (so KDE/means match the bars)
393            cycle = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key().get("color", ["C0", "C1"])
394            used_t = color_t or _patch_color(ht[2], cycle[0])
395            used_c = color_c or _patch_color(hc[2], cycle[1])
396
397            # ------- KDE (stable NumPy implementation) -------------------------
398            if kde:
399                if clip:
400                    lo, hi = np.quantile(np.clip(m, 0, 1), [clip[0], clip[1]])
401                    lo, hi = float(max(0.0, lo)), float(min(1.0, hi))
402                    if not (hi > lo):
403                        lo, hi = 0.0, 1.0
404                else:
405                    lo, hi = 0.0, 1.0
406
407                xs = np.linspace(0.0, 1.0, 800)
408                h_t = _silverman_bandwidth(mtp)
409                h_c = _silverman_bandwidth(mcp)
410                yt = _kde_reflect(mtp, xs, h_t)
411                yc = _kde_reflect(mcp, xs, h_c)
412
413                ax.plot(xs, yt, linewidth=2.2, label="Treated (KDE)", color=used_t, antialiased=True)
414                ax.plot(xs, yc, linewidth=2.2, linestyle="--", label="Control (KDE)", color=used_c, antialiased=True)
415
416                if shade_overlap:
417                    y_min = np.minimum(yt, yc)
418                    ax.fill_between(xs, y_min, 0, alpha=0.12, color="grey", rasterized=False)
419
420            # ------- Means ------------------------------------------------------
421            ax.axvline(float(mtp.mean()), linestyle=":", linewidth=1.8, color=used_t, alpha=0.95)
422            ax.axvline(float(mcp.mean()), linestyle=":", linewidth=1.8, color=used_c, alpha=0.95)
423
424            # ------- Cosmetics --------------------------------------------------
425            ax.set_xlabel(r"$m(x) = \mathbb{P}(D=1 \mid X)$")
426            ax.set_ylabel("Density")
427            ax.set_title("Propensity Overlap by Treatment Group")
428            ax.set_xlim(0.0, 1.0)
429            ax.grid(True, linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
430            for spine in ("top", "right"):
431                ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)
432            ax.legend(frameon=False)
433            fig.tight_layout()
434
435            # ------- Optional save ---------------------------------------------
436            if save is not None:
437                ext = str(save).lower().split(".")[-1]
438                _dpi = save_dpi or (300 if ext in {"png", "jpg", "jpeg", "tif", "tiff"} else dpi)
439                fig.savefig(
440                    save, dpi=_dpi, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.1,
441                    transparent=transparent,
442                    facecolor="none" if transparent else "white"
443                )
444
445        return fig
446
447    def positivity_check_m(self, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (0.05, 0.95)) -> Dict[str, Any]:
448        """Check overlap/positivity for m(x) based on thresholds."""
449        low, high = bounds
450        m = self.m
451        return {
452            "bounds": bounds,
453            "share_below": float((m < low).mean()),
454            "share_above": float((m > high).mean()),
455            "flag": bool(((m < low).mean() + (m > high).mean()) > 0.02),
456        }
457
458    # Back-compat shims
459    def ps_graph(self, *args, **kwargs):
460        _warn_once("ps_graph()", "plot_m_overlap()")
461        return self.plot_m_overlap(*args, **kwargs)
462
463    def positivity_check(self, *args, **kwargs):
464        _warn_once("positivity_check()", "positivity_check_m()")
465        return self.positivity_check_m(*args, **kwargs)

A model for m(x) = P(D=1|X) and related diagnostics.

This class encapsulates propensity m and provides methods for:

  • Computing ROC AUC (AUC of D vs m)
  • Extracting SHAP values
  • Plotting m overlap
  • Checking positivity/overlap

The class is returned by CausalEDA.fit_m() and provides a cleaner interface for propensity analysis.

@classmethod
def from_kfold( cls, X: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, t: numpy.ndarray, model: Any | None = None, n_splits: int = 5, random_state: int = 42, preprocessor: sklearn.compose._column_transformer.ColumnTransformer | None = None) -> PropensityModel: 
111    @classmethod
112    def from_kfold(
113        cls,
114        X: pd.DataFrame,
115        t: np.ndarray,
116        model: Optional[Any] = None,
117        n_splits: int = 5,
118        random_state: int = 42,
119        preprocessor: Optional[ColumnTransformer] = None,
120    ) -> "PropensityModel":
121        """Estimate m(x) via K-fold and return a PropensityModel.
122
123        Produces out-of-fold m estimates using StratifiedKFold. If no
124        model is provided, a fast LogisticRegression is used. Categorical
125        features are one-hot encoded and numeric features standardized by
126        default using a ColumnTransformer.
127        """
128        # Ensure inputs are aligned
129        if isinstance(X, pd.DataFrame):
130            feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
131        else:
132            raise ValueError("X must be a pandas DataFrame with named columns.")
133        t = np.asarray(t).astype(int)
134        # validate binary treatment
135        if not np.isin(t, [0, 1]).all():
136            raise ValueError("Treatment must be binary {0,1}.")
137
138        # Preprocessor default
139        if preprocessor is None:
140            num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
141            cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
142            num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))])
143            preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
144                transformers=[
145                    ("num", num_transformer, num),
146                    ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
147                ],
148                remainder="drop",
149            )
150
151        # Model default
152        if model is None:
153            model = LogisticRegression(max_iter=1000)
154
155        cv = StratifiedKFold(n_splits=n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=random_state)
156
157        # Compute out-of-fold probabilities
158        if isinstance(model, CatBoostClassifier):
159            import warnings
160            ps = np.zeros(len(X))
161            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
162                with warnings.catch_warnings():
163                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
164                    for tr_idx, te_idx in cv.split(X, t):
165                        X_tr, X_te = X.iloc[tr_idx], X.iloc[te_idx]
166                        t_tr = t[tr_idx]
167                        X_tr_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_tr)
168                        X_te_p = preprocessor.transform(X_te)
169                        fold_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
170                        fold_model.fit(X_tr_p, t_tr)
171                        ps[te_idx] = fold_model.predict_proba(X_te_p)[:, 1]
172            # Fit final model for SHAP
173            X_full_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X)
174            final_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_state=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
175            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
176                final_model.fit(X_full_p, t)
177            X_for_shap = X_full_p
178            fitted = final_model
179            # use transformed feature names for SHAP alignment
180            try:
181                feature_names = preprocessor.get_feature_names_out().tolist()
182            except Exception:
183                feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(X_full_p.shape[1])]
184        else:
185            pipe = Pipeline([("prep", preprocessor), ("clf", model)])
186            import warnings
187            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
188                with warnings.catch_warnings():
189                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
190                    ps = cross_val_predict(pipe, X, t, cv=cv, method="predict_proba")[:, 1]
191                    pipe.fit(X, t)
192            fitted = pipe
193            X_for_shap = None
194
195        # clip for stability
196        ps = np.clip(ps, 1e-6, 1 - 1e-6)
197
198        return cls(
199            propensity_scores=ps,
200            treatment_values=t,
201            fitted_model=fitted,
202            feature_names=feature_names,
203            X_for_shap=X_for_shap,
204        )

Estimate m(x) via K-fold and return a PropensityModel.

Produces out-of-fold m estimates using StratifiedKFold. If no model is provided, a fast LogisticRegression is used. Categorical features are one-hot encoded and numeric features standardized by default using a ColumnTransformer.

roc_auc: float 
206    @property
207    def roc_auc(self) -> float:
208        """Compute ROC AUC of treatment assignment vs. m(x).
209        
210        Higher AUC means treatment is more predictable from confounders,
211        indicating stronger systematic differences between groups (potential
212        cofounding). Values near 0.5 suggest random-like assignment.
213        
214        Returns
215        -------
216        float
217            ROC AUC score between 0 and 1
218        """
219        return float(roc_auc_score(self.d, self.m))

  • float: ROC AUC score between 0 and 1
shap: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame 
221    @property
222    def shap(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
223        """Return feature attribution from the fitted propensity model.
224        
225        For CatBoost models: returns SHAP-based attributions with both signed mean (shap_mean)
226        and magnitude (shap_mean_abs), sorted by shap_mean_abs.
227        
228        For sklearn linear models (LogisticRegression): returns absolute coefficients under
229        column 'coef_abs' (not SHAP), sorted descending.
230        """
231        # Extract SHAP values or feature importance based on model type
232        if isinstance(self.fitted_model, CatBoostClassifier):
233            try:
234                from catboost import Pool
235                if self.X_for_shap is None:
236                    raise RuntimeError("Preprocessed data for SHAP computation not available.")
237                shap_pool = Pool(data=self.X_for_shap)
238                shap_values = self.fitted_model.get_feature_importance(type='ShapValues', data=shap_pool)
239                shap_values_no_bias = shap_values[:, :-1]
240                shap_mean = np.mean(shap_values_no_bias, axis=0)
241                shap_mean_abs = np.mean(np.abs(shap_values_no_bias), axis=0)
242                feature_names = list(self.feature_names)
243                if len(feature_names) != shap_values_no_bias.shape[1]:
244                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match SHAP values. Ensure transformed names are used.")
245                result_df = pd.DataFrame({
246                    'feature': feature_names,
247                    'shap_mean': shap_mean,
248                    'shap_mean_abs': shap_mean_abs,
249                })
250                # Sort by absolute shap_mean (test expects this order)
251                result_df['abs_shap_mean'] = np.abs(result_df['shap_mean'].values)
252                result_df = result_df.sort_values('abs_shap_mean', ascending=False).drop(columns=['abs_shap_mean']).reset_index(drop=True)
253                # Augment with probability-scale metrics using baseline p0 = mean propensity score
254                p0 = float(np.mean(self.propensity_scores))
255                p0 = float(np.clip(p0, 1e-9, 1 - 1e-9))
256                logit_p0 = float(np.log(p0 / (1.0 - p0)))
257                # result_df['odds_mult_abs'] = np.exp(result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values)
258                result_df['exact_pp_change_abs'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values))) - p0
259                result_df['exact_pp_change_signed'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean'].values))) - p0
260                return result_df
261            except Exception as e:
262                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract SHAP values from CatBoost model: {e}")
263        elif hasattr(self.fitted_model, 'named_steps') and hasattr(self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('clf'), 'coef_'):
264            try:
265                clf = self.fitted_model.named_steps['clf']
266                coef_abs = np.abs(clf.coef_[0])
267                prep = self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('prep')
268                if hasattr(prep, 'get_feature_names_out'):
269                    try:
270                        feature_names = [str(n) for n in prep.get_feature_names_out()]
271                    except Exception:
272                        feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
273                else:
274                    feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
275                if len(coef_abs) != len(feature_names):
276                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match coefficients.")
277                df = pd.DataFrame({'feature': feature_names, 'importance': coef_abs, 'coef_abs': coef_abs}).sort_values('importance', ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)
278                return df
279            except Exception as e:
280                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract feature importance from sklearn model: {e}")
281        else:
282            raise RuntimeError(f"Feature importance extraction not supported for model type: {type(self.fitted_model)}")

Return feature attribution from the fitted propensity model.

For CatBoost models: returns SHAP-based attributions with both signed mean (shap_mean) and magnitude (shap_mean_abs), sorted by shap_mean_abs.

For sklearn linear models (LogisticRegression): returns absolute coefficients under column 'coef_abs' (not SHAP), sorted descending.

def plot_m_overlap( self, clip=(0.01, 0.99), bins='fd', kde=True, shade_overlap=True, ax=None, figsize=(9, 5.5), dpi=220, font_scale=1.15, save=None, save_dpi=None, transparent=False, color_t=None, color_c=None): 
289    def plot_m_overlap(
290            self,
291            clip=(0.01, 0.99),
292            bins="fd",
293            kde=True,
294            shade_overlap=True,
295            ax=None,
296            figsize=(9, 5.5),
297            dpi=220,
298            font_scale=1.15,
299            save=None,
300            save_dpi=None,
301            transparent=False,
302            color_t=None,  # None -> use Matplotlib defaults
303            color_c=None,  # None -> use Matplotlib defaults
304    ):
305        """
306        Overlap plot for m(x)=P(D=1|X) with high-res rendering.
307        - x in [0,1]
308        - Stable NumPy KDE w/ boundary reflection (no SciPy warnings)
309        - Uses Matplotlib default colors unless color_t/color_c are provided
310        """
311        import numpy as np
312        import matplotlib as mpl
313        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
314
315        # ------- Helpers --------------------------------------------------------
316        def _silverman_bandwidth(x):
317            x = np.asarray(x, float)
318            n = x.size
319            if n < 2:
320                return 0.04
321            sd = np.std(x, ddof=1)
322            iqr = np.subtract(*np.percentile(x, [75, 25]))
323            s = sd if iqr <= 0 else min(sd, iqr / 1.34)
324            h = 0.9 * s * n ** (-1 / 5)
325            return float(max(h, 0.02))
326
327        def _kde_reflect(x, xs, h):
328            x = np.asarray(x, float)
329            if x.size == 0:
330                return np.zeros_like(xs)
331            if x.size < 2 or np.std(x) < 1e-8:
332                mu = float(np.mean(x)) if x.size else 0.5
333                h0 = max(h, 0.02)
334                z = (xs - mu) / h0
335                return np.exp(-0.5 * z ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h0)
336            xr = np.concatenate([x, -x, 2 - x])  # reflect at 0 and 1
337            diff = (xs[None, :] - xr[:, None]) / h
338            kern = np.exp(-0.5 * diff ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h)
339            return kern.mean(axis=0)
340
341        def _patch_color(patches, fallback):
342            # Grab facecolor from the first bar; fallback to cycle color if needed
343            for p in patches:
344                fc = p.get_facecolor()
345                if fc is not None:
346                    return fc  # RGBA
347            return fallback
348
349        # ------- Data -----------------------------------------------------------
350        d = np.asarray(self.d).astype(int)
351        m = np.asarray(self.m, dtype=float)
352        mask = np.isfinite(m) & np.isfinite(d)
353        d, m = d[mask], m[mask]
354        mt = m[d == 1]
355        mc = m[d == 0]
356        if mt.size == 0 or mc.size == 0:
357            raise ValueError("Both treated and control must have at least one observation after cleaning.")
358
359        # Clamp to [0,1] to keep plot stable and inside bounds
360        mtp = np.clip(mt, 0.0, 1.0)
361        mcp = np.clip(mc, 0.0, 1.0)
362
363        # ------- Figure/axes with high DPI & scaled fonts ----------------------
364        rc = {
365            "font.size": 11 * font_scale,
366            "axes.titlesize": 13 * font_scale,
367            "axes.labelsize": 12 * font_scale,
368            "legend.fontsize": 10 * font_scale,
369            "xtick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
370            "ytick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
371        }
372        with mpl.rc_context(rc):
373            if ax is None:
374                fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=figsize, dpi=dpi)
375            else:
376                fig = ax.figure
377                try:
378                    fig.set_dpi(dpi)
379                except Exception:
380                    pass
381
382            # ------- Histograms (ALWAYS [0,1]) ---------------------------------
383            ht = ax.hist(mtp, bins=bins, range=(0.0, 1.0), density=True,
384                         alpha=0.45, label=f"Treated (n={mt.size})",
385                         edgecolor="white", linewidth=0.6,
386                         color=color_t)  # None -> default color
387            hc = ax.hist(mcp, bins=bins, range=(0.0, 1.0), density=True,
388                         alpha=0.45, label=f"Control (n={mc.size})",
389                         edgecolor="white", linewidth=0.6,
390                         color=color_c)  # None -> default color
391
392            # Determine the actual colors used (so KDE/means match the bars)
393            cycle = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key().get("color", ["C0", "C1"])
394            used_t = color_t or _patch_color(ht[2], cycle[0])
395            used_c = color_c or _patch_color(hc[2], cycle[1])
396
397            # ------- KDE (stable NumPy implementation) -------------------------
398            if kde:
399                if clip:
400                    lo, hi = np.quantile(np.clip(m, 0, 1), [clip[0], clip[1]])
401                    lo, hi = float(max(0.0, lo)), float(min(1.0, hi))
402                    if not (hi > lo):
403                        lo, hi = 0.0, 1.0
404                else:
405                    lo, hi = 0.0, 1.0
406
407                xs = np.linspace(0.0, 1.0, 800)
408                h_t = _silverman_bandwidth(mtp)
409                h_c = _silverman_bandwidth(mcp)
410                yt = _kde_reflect(mtp, xs, h_t)
411                yc = _kde_reflect(mcp, xs, h_c)
412
413                ax.plot(xs, yt, linewidth=2.2, label="Treated (KDE)", color=used_t, antialiased=True)
414                ax.plot(xs, yc, linewidth=2.2, linestyle="--", label="Control (KDE)", color=used_c, antialiased=True)
415
416                if shade_overlap:
417                    y_min = np.minimum(yt, yc)
418                    ax.fill_between(xs, y_min, 0, alpha=0.12, color="grey", rasterized=False)
419
420            # ------- Means ------------------------------------------------------
421            ax.axvline(float(mtp.mean()), linestyle=":", linewidth=1.8, color=used_t, alpha=0.95)
422            ax.axvline(float(mcp.mean()), linestyle=":", linewidth=1.8, color=used_c, alpha=0.95)
423
424            # ------- Cosmetics --------------------------------------------------
425            ax.set_xlabel(r"$m(x) = \mathbb{P}(D=1 \mid X)$")
426            ax.set_ylabel("Density")
427            ax.set_title("Propensity Overlap by Treatment Group")
428            ax.set_xlim(0.0, 1.0)
429            ax.grid(True, linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
430            for spine in ("top", "right"):
431                ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)
432            ax.legend(frameon=False)
433            fig.tight_layout()
434
435            # ------- Optional save ---------------------------------------------
436            if save is not None:
437                ext = str(save).lower().split(".")[-1]
438                _dpi = save_dpi or (300 if ext in {"png", "jpg", "jpeg", "tif", "tiff"} else dpi)
439                fig.savefig(
440                    save, dpi=_dpi, bbox_inches="tight", pad_inches=0.1,
441                    transparent=transparent,
442                    facecolor="none" if transparent else "white"
443                )
444
445        return fig

Overlap plot for m(x)=P(D=1|X) with high-res rendering.

  • x in [0,1]
  • Stable NumPy KDE w/ boundary reflection (no SciPy warnings)
  • Uses Matplotlib default colors unless color_t/color_c are provided

class OutcomeModel: 
468class OutcomeModel:
469    """A model for outcome prediction and related diagnostics.
470
471    This class encapsulates outcome predictions and provides methods for:
472    - Computing RMSE and MAE regression metrics
473    - Extracting SHAP values for outcome prediction
474
475    The class is returned by CausalEDA.outcome_fit() and provides a cleaner
476    interface for outcome model analysis.
477    """
478
479    def __init__(self,
480                 predicted_outcomes: np.ndarray,
481                 actual_outcomes: np.ndarray,
482                 fitted_model: Any,
483                 feature_names: List[str],
484                 X_for_shap: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
485                 cat_features_for_shap: Optional[List[int]] = None):
486        """Initialize OutcomeModel with fitted model artifacts.
487
488        Parameters
489        ----------
490        predicted_outcomes : np.ndarray
491            Array of predicted outcome values
492        actual_outcomes : np.ndarray
493            Array of actual outcome values
494        fitted_model : Any
495            The fitted outcome prediction model
496        feature_names : List[str]
497            Names of features used in the model (confounders only)
498        X_for_shap : Optional[np.ndarray]
499            Preprocessed feature matrix for SHAP computation
500        cat_features_for_shap : Optional[List[int]]
501            Categorical feature indices for SHAP computation
502        """
503        self.predicted_outcomes = predicted_outcomes
504        self.actual_outcomes = actual_outcomes
505        self.fitted_model = fitted_model
506        self.feature_names = feature_names
507        self.X_for_shap = X_for_shap
508        self.cat_features_for_shap = cat_features_for_shap
509
510    @classmethod
511    def from_kfold(
512        cls,
513        X: pd.DataFrame,
514        y: np.ndarray,
515        model: Optional[Any] = None,
516        n_splits: int = 5,
517        random_state: int = 42,
518        preprocessor: Optional[ColumnTransformer] = None,
519    ) -> "OutcomeModel":
520        """Estimate an outcome model via K-fold and return an OutcomeModel.
521
522        Produces out-of-fold predictions using KFold. If no model is provided,
523        a fast LinearRegression is used. Categorical features are one-hot
524        encoded and numeric features standardized by default.
525        """
526        if not isinstance(X, pd.DataFrame):
527            raise ValueError("X must be a pandas DataFrame with named columns.")
528        feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
529        y = np.asarray(y)
530
531        # Preprocessor default
532        if preprocessor is None:
533            num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
534            cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
535            num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))])
536            preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
537                transformers=[
538                    ("num", num_transformer, num),
539                    ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
540                ],
541                remainder="drop",
542            )
543
544        # Model default
545        if model is None:
546            model = LinearRegression()
547
548        cv = KFold(n_splits=n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=random_state)
549
550        if isinstance(model, CatBoostRegressor):
551            import warnings
552            preds = np.zeros(len(X))
553            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
554                with warnings.catch_warnings():
555                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
556                    for tr_idx, te_idx in cv.split(X, y):
557                        X_tr, X_te = X.iloc[tr_idx], X.iloc[te_idx]
558                        y_tr = y[tr_idx]
559                        X_tr_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_tr)
560                        X_te_p = preprocessor.transform(X_te)
561                        fold_model = CatBoostRegressor(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
562                        fold_model.fit(X_tr_p, y_tr)
563                        preds[te_idx] = fold_model.predict(X_te_p)
564            # Fit final model for SHAP
565            X_full_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X)
566            final_model = CatBoostRegressor(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
567            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
568                final_model.fit(X_full_p, y)
569            fitted = final_model
570            X_for_shap = X_full_p
571        else:
572            pipe = Pipeline([("prep", preprocessor), ("reg", model)])
573            import warnings
574            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
575                with warnings.catch_warnings():
576                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
577                    preds = cross_val_predict(pipe, X, y, cv=cv)
578                    pipe.fit(X, y)
579            fitted = pipe
580            X_for_shap = None
581
582        return cls(
583            predicted_outcomes=preds,
584            actual_outcomes=y,
585            fitted_model=fitted,
586            feature_names=feature_names,
587            X_for_shap=X_for_shap,
588        )
589    
590    @property
591    def scores(self) -> Dict[str, float]:
592        """Compute regression metrics (RMSE and MAE) for outcome predictions.
593        
594        Returns
595        -------
596        Dict[str, float]
597            Dictionary containing:
598            - 'rmse': Root Mean Squared Error
599            - 'mae': Mean Absolute Error
600        """
601        mse = mean_squared_error(self.actual_outcomes, self.predicted_outcomes)
602        rmse = np.sqrt(mse)
603        mae = mean_absolute_error(self.actual_outcomes, self.predicted_outcomes)
604        
605        return {
606            'rmse': float(rmse),
607            'mae': float(mae)
608        }
609    
610    @property
611    def shap(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
612        """Return SHAP values from the fitted outcome prediction model.
613        
614        SHAP values show the directional contribution of each feature to 
615        outcome prediction, where positive values increase the predicted 
616        outcome and negative values decrease it.
617        
618        Returns
619        -------
620        pd.DataFrame
621            For CatBoost models: DataFrame with columns 'feature' and 'shap_mean',
622            where 'shap_mean' represents the mean SHAP value across all samples.
623            
624            For sklearn models: DataFrame with columns 'feature' and 'importance'
625            (absolute coefficient values, for backward compatibility).
626            
627        Raises
628        ------
629        RuntimeError
630            If the fitted model does not support SHAP values extraction.
631        """
632        # Extract SHAP values or feature importance based on model type
633        if isinstance(self.fitted_model, CatBoostRegressor):
634            # Use CatBoost's SHAP values for directional feature contributions
635            try:
636                # Import Pool for SHAP computation
637                from catboost import Pool
638                
639                # Check if we have the required data for SHAP computation
640                if self.X_for_shap is None:
641                    raise RuntimeError("Preprocessed data for SHAP computation not available.")
642                
643                # Create Pool object for SHAP computation (numeric-only after preprocessing)
644                shap_pool = Pool(data=self.X_for_shap)
645                
646                # Get SHAP values - returns array of shape (n_samples, n_features + 1) 
647                # where the last column is the bias term
648                shap_values = self.fitted_model.get_feature_importance(type='ShapValues', data=shap_pool)
649                
650                # Remove bias term (last column) and compute mean SHAP values across samples
651                # This gives us the average directional contribution of each feature
652                shap_values_no_bias = shap_values[:, :-1]  # Remove bias column
653                importance_values = np.mean(shap_values_no_bias, axis=0)  # Mean across samples
654                
655                feature_names = self.feature_names
656                column_name = 'shap_mean'  # Use different column name to indicate SHAP values
657                
658            except Exception as e:
659                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract SHAP values from CatBoost model: {e}")
660        
661        elif hasattr(self.fitted_model, 'named_steps') and hasattr(self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('clf'), 'coef_'):
662            # Handle sklearn pipeline with linear regression
663            try:
664                clf = self.fitted_model.named_steps['clf']
665                # For linear regression, use absolute coefficients as importance
666                importance_values = np.abs(clf.coef_)
667                
668                # Need to map back to original feature names through preprocessing
669                # For simplicity, if we have preprocessed features, we'll use the original feature names
670                # and aggregate importance for one-hot encoded categorical features
671                prep = self.fitted_model.named_steps.get('prep')
672                if hasattr(prep, 'get_feature_names_out'):
673                    try:
674                        # Try to get feature names from preprocessor
675                        transformed_names = prep.get_feature_names_out()
676                        feature_names = [str(name) for name in transformed_names]
677                    except:
678                        # Fallback to original feature names if transformation fails
679                        feature_names = self.feature_names
680                        if len(importance_values) != len(feature_names):
681                            # If lengths don't match due to one-hot encoding, we can't map back easily
682                            # Just use indices as feature names
683                            feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(importance_values))]
684                else:
685                    feature_names = self.feature_names
686                
687                column_name = 'importance'  # Keep backward compatibility for sklearn models
688                    
689            except Exception as e:
690                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract feature importance from sklearn model: {e}")
691        
692        else:
693            raise RuntimeError(f"Feature importance extraction not supported for model type: {type(self.fitted_model)}")
694        
695        # Ensure we have matching lengths
696        if len(importance_values) != len(feature_names):
697            # This can happen with preprocessing transformations
698            # Create generic feature names if needed
699            if len(importance_values) > len(feature_names):
700                feature_names = feature_names + [f"transformed_feature_{i}" for i in range(len(feature_names), len(importance_values))]
701            else:
702                feature_names = feature_names[:len(importance_values)]
703        
704        # Create DataFrame with appropriate column name
705        result_df = pd.DataFrame({
706            'feature': feature_names,
707            column_name: importance_values
708        })
709        
710        # Sort appropriately: by absolute value for SHAP values (to show most impactful features),
711        # by value for regular importance (higher is better)
712        if column_name == 'shap_mean':
713            # For SHAP values, sort by absolute value to show most impactful features first
714            result_df = result_df.reindex(result_df[column_name].abs().sort_values(ascending=False).index)
715        else:
716            # For regular importance, sort by value (descending)
717            result_df = result_df.sort_values(column_name, ascending=False)
718        
719        result_df = result_df.reset_index(drop=True)
720        return result_df

A model for outcome prediction and related diagnostics.

This class encapsulates outcome predictions and provides methods for:

  • Computing RMSE and MAE regression metrics
  • Extracting SHAP values for outcome prediction

The class is returned by CausalEDA.outcome_fit() and provides a cleaner interface for outcome model analysis.

OutcomeModel( predicted_outcomes: numpy.ndarray, actual_outcomes: numpy.ndarray, fitted_model: Any, feature_names: List[str], X_for_shap: numpy.ndarray | None = None, cat_features_for_shap: List[int] | None = None) 
479    def __init__(self,
480                 predicted_outcomes: np.ndarray,
481                 actual_outcomes: np.ndarray,
482                 fitted_model: Any,
483                 feature_names: List[str],
484                 X_for_shap: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
485                 cat_features_for_shap: Optional[List[int]] = None):
486        """Initialize OutcomeModel with fitted model artifacts.
487
488        Parameters
489        ----------
490        predicted_outcomes : np.ndarray
491            Array of predicted outcome values
492        actual_outcomes : np.ndarray
493            Array of actual outcome values
494        fitted_model : Any
495            The fitted outcome prediction model
496        feature_names : List[str]
497            Names of features used in the model (confounders only)
498        X_for_shap : Optional[np.ndarray]
499            Preprocessed feature matrix for SHAP computation
500        cat_features_for_shap : Optional[List[int]]
501            Categorical feature indices for SHAP computation
502        """
503        self.predicted_outcomes = predicted_outcomes
504        self.actual_outcomes = actual_outcomes
505        self.fitted_model = fitted_model
506        self.feature_names = feature_names
507        self.X_for_shap = X_for_shap
508        self.cat_features_for_shap = cat_features_for_shap
