@classmethod
def from_kfold( cls, X: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y: numpy.ndarray, model: Any | None = None, n_splits: int = 5, random_state: int = 42, preprocessor: sklearn.compose._column_transformer.ColumnTransformer | None = None) -> OutcomeModel: 
510    @classmethod
511    def from_kfold(
512        cls,
513        X: pd.DataFrame,
514        y: np.ndarray,
515        model: Optional[Any] = None,
516        n_splits: int = 5,
517        random_state: int = 42,
518        preprocessor: Optional[ColumnTransformer] = None,
519    ) -> "OutcomeModel":
520        """Estimate an outcome model via K-fold and return an OutcomeModel.
521
522        Produces out-of-fold predictions using KFold. If no model is provided,
523        a fast LinearRegression is used. Categorical features are one-hot
524        encoded and numeric features standardized by default.
525        """
526        if not isinstance(X, pd.DataFrame):
527            raise ValueError("X must be a pandas DataFrame with named columns.")
528        feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
529        y = np.asarray(y)
530
531        # Preprocessor default
532        if preprocessor is None:
533            num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
534            cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
535            num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))])
536            preprocessor = ColumnTransformer(
537                transformers=[
538                    ("num", num_transformer, num),
539                    ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
540                ],
541                remainder="drop",
542            )
543
544        # Model default
545        if model is None:
546            model = LinearRegression()
547
548        cv = KFold(n_splits=n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=random_state)
549
550        if isinstance(model, CatBoostRegressor):
551            import warnings
552            preds = np.zeros(len(X))
553            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
554                with warnings.catch_warnings():
555                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
556                    for tr_idx, te_idx in cv.split(X, y):
557                        X_tr, X_te = X.iloc[tr_idx], X.iloc[te_idx]
558                        y_tr = y[tr_idx]
559                        X_tr_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X_tr)
560                        X_te_p = preprocessor.transform(X_te)
561                        fold_model = CatBoostRegressor(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
562                        fold_model.fit(X_tr_p, y_tr)
563                        preds[te_idx] = fold_model.predict(X_te_p)
564            # Fit final model for SHAP
565            X_full_p = preprocessor.fit_transform(X)
566            final_model = CatBoostRegressor(thread_count=-1, random_seed=random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
567            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
568                final_model.fit(X_full_p, y)
569            fitted = final_model
570            X_for_shap = X_full_p
571        else:
572            pipe = Pipeline([("prep", preprocessor), ("reg", model)])
573            import warnings
574            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
575                with warnings.catch_warnings():
576                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
577                    preds = cross_val_predict(pipe, X, y, cv=cv)
578                    pipe.fit(X, y)
579            fitted = pipe
580            X_for_shap = None
581
582        return cls(
583            predicted_outcomes=preds,
584            actual_outcomes=y,
585            fitted_model=fitted,
586            feature_names=feature_names,
587            X_for_shap=X_for_shap,
588        )

Estimate an outcome model via K-fold and return an OutcomeModel.

Produces out-of-fold predictions using KFold. If no model is provided, a fast LinearRegression is used. Categorical features are one-hot encoded and numeric features standardized by default.

@dataclass
class CausalDataLite: 
727@dataclass
728class CausalDataLite:
729    """A minimal container for dataset roles used by CausalEDA.
730
731    Attributes
732    - df: The full pandas DataFrame containing treatment, outcome and covariates.
733    - treatment: Column name of the binary treatment indicator (0/1).
734    - outcome: Column name of the outcome variable.
735    - confounders: List of covariate column names used to model treatment.
736    """
737    df: pd.DataFrame
738    treatment: str
739    outcome: str
740    confounders: List[str]

A minimal container for dataset roles used by CausalEDA.

Attributes

  • df: The full pandas DataFrame containing treatment, outcome and covariates.
  • treatment: Column name of the binary treatment indicator (0/1).
  • outcome: Column name of the outcome variable.
  • confounders: List of covariate column names used to model treatment.
CausalDataLite( df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, treatment: str, outcome: str, confounders: List[str])
df: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame
treatment: str
outcome: str

class CausalEDA: 
 781class CausalEDA:
 782    """Exploratory diagnostics for causal designs with binary treatment.
 783
 784    The class exposes methods to:
 785    
 786    - Summarize outcome by treatment and naive mean difference.
 787    - Estimate cross-validated propensity scores and assess treatment
 788      predictability (AUC) and positivity/overlap.
 789    - Inspect covariate balance via standardized mean differences (SMD)
 790      before/after IPTW weighting; visualize with a love plot.
 791    - Inspect weight distributions and effective sample size (ESS).
 792    """
 793    def __init__(self, data: Any, ps_model: Optional[Any] = None, n_splits: int = 5, random_state: int = 42):
 794        roles = _extract_roles(data)
 795        self.d = CausalDataLite(df=roles["df"], treatment=roles["treatment"], outcome=roles["outcome"], confounders=roles["confounders"])
 796        self.n_splits = n_splits
 797        self.random_state = random_state
 798        self.ps_model = ps_model or CatBoostClassifier(
 799            thread_count=-1,  # Use all available threads
 800            random_seed=random_state,
 801            verbose=False,  # Suppress training output
 802            allow_writing_files=False
 803        )
 804
 805        # Preprocessing: always make features numeric via OneHotEncoder for categoricals
 806        X = self.d.df[self.d.confounders]
 807        num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
 808        cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
 809
 810        num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
 811            ("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))
 812        ])
 813        self.preproc = ColumnTransformer(
 814            transformers=[
 815                ("num", num_transformer, num),
 816                ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
 817            ],
 818            remainder="drop",
 819        )
 820        
 821        self.ps_pipe = Pipeline([("prep", self.preproc), ("clf", self.ps_model)])
 822        # Optional: clarify no native categorical indices are used post-OHE
 823        self.cat_features = None
 824
 825    # ---------- basics ----------
 826
 827    def data_shape(self) -> Dict[str, int]:
 828        """Return the shape information of the causal dataset.
 829
 830        Returns a dict with:
 831        - n_rows: number of rows (observations) in the dataset
 832        - n_columns: number of columns (features) in the dataset
 833        
 834        This provides a quick overview of the dataset dimensions for 
 835        exploratory analysis and reporting purposes.
 836        
 837        Returns
 838        -------
 839        Dict[str, int]
 840            Dictionary containing 'n_rows' and 'n_columns' keys with 
 841            corresponding integer values representing the dataset dimensions.
 842        
 843        Examples
 844        --------
 845        >>> eda = CausalEDA(causal_data)
 846        >>> shape_info = eda.data_shape()
 847        >>> print(f"Dataset has {shape_info['n_rows']} rows and {shape_info['n_columns']} columns")
 848        """
 849        df = self.d.df
 850        n_rows, n_columns = df.shape
 851        return {"n_rows": n_rows, "n_columns": n_columns}
 852
 853
 854    def outcome_stats(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 855        """Comprehensive outcome statistics grouped by treatment.
 856
 857        Returns a DataFrame with detailed outcome statistics for each treatment group,
 858        including count, mean, std, min, various percentiles, and max.
 859        This method provides comprehensive outcome analysis and returns
 860        data in a clean DataFrame format suitable for reporting.
 861
 862        Returns
 863        -------
 864        pd.DataFrame
 865            DataFrame with treatment groups as index and the following columns:
 866            - count: number of observations in each group
 867            - mean: average outcome value
 868            - std: standard deviation of outcome
 869            - min: minimum outcome value
 870            - p10: 10th percentile
 871            - p25: 25th percentile (Q1)
 872            - median: 50th percentile (median)
 873            - p75: 75th percentile (Q3)
 874            - p90: 90th percentile
 875            - max: maximum outcome value
 876
 877        Examples
 878        --------
 879        >>> eda = CausalEDA(causal_data)
 880        >>> stats = eda.outcome_stats()
 881        >>> print(stats)
 882                count      mean       std       min       p10       p25    median       p75       p90       max
 883        treatment                                                                                                
 884        0        3000  5.123456  2.345678  0.123456  2.345678  3.456789  5.123456  6.789012  7.890123  9.876543
 885        1        2000  6.789012  2.456789  0.234567  3.456789  4.567890  6.789012  8.901234  9.012345  10.987654
 886        """
 887        df, t, y = self.d.df, self.d.treatment, self.d.outcome
 888        
 889        # Ensure treatment is numeric for grouping
 890        if not pd.api.types.is_numeric_dtype(df[t]):
 891            raise ValueError("Treatment must be numeric 0/1 for outcome_stats().")
 892        
 893        # Create grouped object for multiple operations
 894        grouped = df.groupby(t)[y]
 895        
 896        # Calculate basic statistics using built-in methods
 897        basic_stats = grouped.agg(['count', 'mean', 'std', 'min', 'median', 'max'])
 898        
 899        # Calculate percentiles separately to avoid pandas aggregation mixing issues
 900        p10 = grouped.quantile(0.10)
 901        p25 = grouped.quantile(0.25) 
 902        p75 = grouped.quantile(0.75)
 903        p90 = grouped.quantile(0.90)
 904        
 905        # Combine all statistics into a single DataFrame
 906        stats_df = pd.DataFrame({
 907            'count': basic_stats['count'],
 908            'mean': basic_stats['mean'],
 909            'std': basic_stats['std'],
 910            'min': basic_stats['min'],
 911            'p10': p10,
 912            'p25': p25,
 913            'median': basic_stats['median'],
 914            'p75': p75,
 915            'p90': p90,
 916            'max': basic_stats['max']
 917        })
 918        
 919        # Ensure the index is named appropriately
 920        stats_df.index.name = 'treatment'
 921        
 922        return stats_df
 923
 924    # ---------- propensity & overlap ----------
 925    def fit_m(self) -> 'PropensityModel':
 926        """Estimate cross-validated m(x) = P(D=1|X).
 927
 928        Uses a preprocessing + classifier setup with stratified K-fold to generate
 929        out-of-fold probabilities. For CatBoost, data are one-hot encoded via the
 930        configured ColumnTransformer before fitting. Returns a PropensityModel.
 931        """
 932        df = self.d.df
 933        X = df[self.d.confounders]
 934        t = df[self.d.treatment].astype(int).values
 935        if not np.isin(t, [0, 1]).all():
 936            raise ValueError("Treatment must be binary {0,1}.")
 937        cv = StratifiedKFold(n_splits=self.n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=self.random_state)
 938
 939        if isinstance(self.ps_model, CatBoostClassifier):
 940            import warnings
 941            ps = np.zeros(len(X))
 942            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 943                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 944                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 945                    for train_idx, test_idx in cv.split(X, t):
 946                        X_train, X_test = X.iloc[train_idx], X.iloc[test_idx]
 947                        t_train = t[train_idx]
 948                        X_train_prep = self.preproc.fit_transform(X_train)
 949                        X_test_prep = self.preproc.transform(X_test)
 950                        model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=self.random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
 951                        model.fit(X_train_prep, t_train)
 952                        ps[test_idx] = model.predict_proba(X_test_prep)[:, 1]
 953        else:
 954            import warnings
 955            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 956                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 957                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 958                    ps = cross_val_predict(self.ps_pipe, X, t, cv=cv, method="predict_proba")[:, 1]
 959
 960        m = np.clip(ps, 1e-6, 1 - 1e-6)
 961        self._m = m
 962
 963        if isinstance(self.ps_model, CatBoostClassifier):
 964            X_full_prep = self.preproc.fit_transform(X)
 965            final_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=self.random_state, verbose=False)
 966            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 967                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 968                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 969                    final_model.fit(X_full_prep, t)
 970            self._fitted_model = final_model
 971            try:
 972                self._feature_names = self.preproc.get_feature_names_out().tolist()
 973            except Exception:
 974                self._feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(X_full_prep.shape[1])]
 975            self._X_for_shap = X_full_prep
 976        else:
 977            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
 978                with warnings.catch_warnings():
 979                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
 980                    self.ps_pipe.fit(X, t)
 981            self._fitted_model = self.ps_pipe
 982            self._feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
 983
 984        return PropensityModel(
 985            m=m,
 986            d=t,
 987            fitted_model=self._fitted_model,
 988            feature_names=self._feature_names,
 989            X_for_shap=getattr(self, '_X_for_shap', None)
 990        )
 991
 992    # Back-compat shim
 993    def fit_propensity(self) -> 'PropensityModel':
 994        _warn_once("fit_propensity()", "fit_m()")
 995        return self.fit_m()
 996
 997    def outcome_fit(self, outcome_model: Optional[Any] = None) -> 'OutcomeModel':
 998        """Fit a regression model to predict outcome from confounders only.
 999
1000        Uses a preprocessing+CatBoost regressor pipeline with K-fold
1001        cross_val_predict to generate out-of-fold predictions. CatBoost uses
1002        all available threads and handles categorical features natively. Returns an
1003        OutcomeModel instance containing predicted outcomes and diagnostic methods.
1004        
1005        The outcome model predicts the baseline outcome from confounders only,
1006        excluding treatment. This is essential for proper causal analysis.
1007        
1008        Parameters
1009        ----------
1010        outcome_model : Optional[Any]
1011            Custom regression model to use. If None, uses CatBoostRegressor.
1012            
1013        Returns
1014        -------
1015        OutcomeModel
1016            An OutcomeModel instance with methods for:
1017            - scores: RMSE and MAE regression metrics
1018            - shap: SHAP values DataFrame property for outcome prediction
1019        """
1020        df = self.d.df
1021        # Features: confounders only (treatment excluded for proper causal analysis)
1022        X = df[self.d.confounders]
1023        y = df[self.d.outcome].values
1024        cv = KFold(n_splits=self.n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=self.random_state)
1025        
1026        # Default to CatBoostRegressor if no custom model provided
1027        if outcome_model is None:
1028            outcome_model = CatBoostRegressor(
1029                thread_count=-1,
1030                random_seed=self.random_state,
1031                verbose=False,
1032                allow_writing_files=False
1033            )
1034        
1035        # Identify numeric and categorical features for preprocessing
1036        num_features = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
1037        cat_features = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num_features]
1038        
1039        # Setup preprocessing: always OHE categoricals so model input is numeric
1040        num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
1041            ("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))
1042        ])
1043        preproc = ColumnTransformer(
1044            transformers=[
1045                ("num", num_transformer, num_features),
1046                ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat_features),
1047            ],
1048            remainder="drop",
1049        )
1050        
1051        # Special handling for CatBoost to properly pass categorical features
1052        if isinstance(outcome_model, CatBoostRegressor):
1053            import warnings
1054            
1055            predictions = np.zeros(len(X))
1056            
1057            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1058                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1059                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1060                    
1061                    for train_idx, test_idx in cv.split(X, y):
1062                        # Prepare data for this fold
1063                        X_train, X_test = X.iloc[train_idx], X.iloc[test_idx]
1064                        y_train = y[train_idx]
1065                        
1066                        # Apply preprocessing
1067                        X_train_prep = preproc.fit_transform(X_train)
1068                        X_test_prep = preproc.transform(X_test)
1069                        
1070                        # Create and train CatBoost model for this fold
1071                        model = CatBoostRegressor(
1072                            thread_count=-1,
1073                            random_seed=self.random_state,
1074                            verbose=False,
1075                            allow_writing_files=False
1076                        )
1077                        
1078                        # All features are numeric after preprocessing; no cat_features needed
1079                        model.fit(X_train_prep, y_train)
1080                        predictions[test_idx] = model.predict(X_test_prep)
1081        else:
1082            # Use standard sklearn pipeline for non-CatBoost models
1083            pipeline = Pipeline([("prep", preproc), ("reg", outcome_model)])
1084            import warnings
1085            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1086                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1087                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1088                    predictions = cross_val_predict(pipeline, X, y, cv=cv)
1089        
1090        self._outcome_predictions = predictions
1091        
1092        # Train a final model on the full dataset for SHAP computation
1093        if isinstance(outcome_model, CatBoostRegressor):
1094            # Apply preprocessing to full dataset
1095            X_full_prep = preproc.fit_transform(X)
1096            
1097            # Create and train final model
1098            final_model = CatBoostRegressor(
1099                thread_count=-1,
1100                random_seed=self.random_state,
1101                verbose=False
1102            )
1103            
1104            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1105                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1106                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1107                    final_model.fit(X_full_prep, y)
1108            
1109            # Store the trained model and data needed for SHAP computation
1110            self._outcome_fitted_model = final_model
1111            self._outcome_feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
1112            self._outcome_X_for_shap = X_full_prep  # Store preprocessed data for SHAP
1113        else:
1114            # For non-CatBoost models, fit the pipeline on full data
1115            pipeline = Pipeline([("prep", preproc), ("reg", outcome_model)])
1116            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1117                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1118                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1119                    pipeline.fit(X, y)
1120            self._outcome_fitted_model = pipeline
1121            self._outcome_feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
1122        
1123        # Create and return OutcomeModel instance
1124        return OutcomeModel(
1125            predicted_outcomes=predictions,
1126            actual_outcomes=y,
1127            fitted_model=self._outcome_fitted_model,
1128            feature_names=self._outcome_feature_names,
1129            X_for_shap=getattr(self, '_outcome_X_for_shap', None)
1130        )
1131
1132    def auc_m(self, m: Optional[np.ndarray] = None) -> float:
1133        """Compute ROC AUC of treatment assignment vs. m(x)."""
1134        if m is None:
1135            m = getattr(self, "_m", None)
1136            if m is None:
1137                pm = self.fit_m()
1138                m = pm.m
1139        t = self.d.df[self.d.treatment].astype(int).values
1140        return float(roc_auc_score(t, m))
1141
1142    def positivity_check_m(self, m: Optional[np.ndarray] = None, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (0.05, 0.95)) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1143        """Check overlap/positivity for m(x) based on thresholds."""
1144        if m is None:
1145            m = getattr(self, "_m", None)
1146            if m is None:
1147                pm = self.fit_m()
1148                m = pm.m
1149        low, high = bounds
1150        return {
1151            "bounds": bounds,
1152            "share_below": float((m < low).mean()),
1153            "share_above": float((m > high).mean()),
1154            "flag": bool(((m < low).mean() + (m > high).mean()) > 0.02),
1155        }
1156
1157    def plot_m_overlap(self, m: Optional[np.ndarray] = None):
1158        """Plot overlaid histograms of m(x) for treated vs control."""
1159        if m is None:
1160            m = getattr(self, "_m", None)
1161            if m is None:
1162                pm = self.fit_m()
1163                m = pm.m
1164        df = self.d.df
1165        t = df[self.d.treatment].astype(int).values
1166        fig, ax = plt.subplots()
1167        ax.hist(m[t == 1], bins=30, alpha=0.5, density=True, label="treated")
1168        ax.hist(m[t == 0], bins=30, alpha=0.5, density=True, label="control")
1169        ax.set_xlabel("m(x) = P(D=1|X)")
1170        ax.set_ylabel("Density")
1171        ax.legend()
1172        ax.set_title("Overlap of m(x)")
1173        return fig
1174
1175    # Back-compat shims for public API
1176    def confounders_roc_auc(self, ps: Optional[np.ndarray] = None) -> float:
1177        _warn_once("confounders_roc_auc()", "auc_m()")
1178        return self.auc_m(m=ps)
1179
1180    def positivity_check(self, ps: Optional[np.ndarray] = None, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (0.05, 0.95)) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1181        _warn_once("positivity_check()", "positivity_check_m()")
1182        return self.positivity_check_m(m=ps, bounds=bounds)
1183
1184    def plot_ps_overlap(self, ps: Optional[np.ndarray] = None):
1185        _warn_once("plot_ps_overlap()", "plot_m_overlap()")
1186        return self.plot_m_overlap(m=ps)

1188    # ---------- balance ----------
1189
1190    def confounders_means(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1191        """Comprehensive confounders balance assessment with means by treatment group.
1192
1193        Returns a DataFrame with detailed balance information including:
1194        - Mean values of each confounder for control group (treatment=0)
1195        - Mean values of each confounder for treated group (treatment=1)
1196        - Absolute difference between treatment groups
1197        - Standardized Mean Difference (SMD) for formal balance assessment
1198        - Kolmogorov–Smirnov statistic (ks) and p-value (ks_pvalue) for distributional differences
1199        
1200        This method provides a comprehensive view of confounder balance by showing
1201        the actual mean values alongside the standardized differences, making it easier
1202        to understand both the magnitude and direction of imbalances.
1203
1204        Returns
1205        -------
1206        pd.DataFrame
1207            DataFrame with confounders as index and the following columns:
1208            - mean_t_0: mean value for control group (treatment=0)
1209            - mean_t_1: mean value for treated group (treatment=1)  
1210            - abs_diff: absolute difference abs(mean_t_1 - mean_t_0)
1211            - smd: standardized mean difference (Cohen's d)
1212            - ks: Kolmogorov–Smirnov statistic
1213            - ks_pvalue: p-value of the KS test
1214            
1215        Notes
1216        -----
1217        SMD values > 0.1 in absolute value typically indicate meaningful imbalance.
1218        Categorical variables are automatically converted to dummy variables.
1219        
1220        Examples
1221        --------
1222        >>> eda = CausalEDA(causal_data)
1223        >>> balance = eda.confounders_means()
1224        >>> print(balance.head())
1225                     mean_t_0  mean_t_1  abs_diff       smd
1226        confounders                                       
1227        age              29.5      31.2      1.7     0.085
1228        income        45000.0   47500.0   2500.0     0.125
1229        education         0.25      0.35      0.1     0.215
1230        """
1231        # Delegate implementation to dedicated balance module for reuse and testing
1232        from .confounders_balance import confounders_balance
1233        return confounders_balance(
1234            df=self.d.df,
1235            treatment=self.d.treatment,
1236            confounders=self.d.confounders,
1237        )
1238
1239    from typing import Optional, Tuple
1240
1241    def outcome_hist(
1242            self,
1243            treatment: Optional[str] = None,
1244            outcome: Optional[str] = None,
1245            bins="fd",  # smarter default (still accepts int)
1246            density: bool = True,
1247            alpha: float = 0.45,
1248            sharex: bool = True,
1249            kde: bool = True,  # overlay smooth density (SciPy-free)
1250            clip: Optional[Tuple[float, float]] = (0.01, 0.99),  # trim tails for nicer view
1251            figsize: Tuple[float, float] = (9, 5.5),
1252            dpi: int = 220,
1253            font_scale: float = 1.15,
1254            save: Optional[str] = None,  # "outcome.png" / ".svg" / ".pdf"
1255            save_dpi: Optional[int] = None,
1256            transparent: bool = False,
1257    ):
1258        """
1259        Plot the distribution of the outcome for each treatment on a single, pretty plot.
1260
1261        Features
1262        --------
1263        - High-DPI canvas + scalable fonts
1264        - Default Matplotlib colors; KDE & mean lines match their histogram colors
1265        - Numeric outcomes: shared x-range (optional), optional KDE, quantile clipping
1266        - Categorical outcomes: normalized grouped bars by treatment
1267        - Optional hi-res export (PNG/SVG/PDF)
1268        """
1269        import numpy as np
1270        import pandas as pd
1271        import matplotlib as mpl
1272        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
1273
1274        # ---------- Helpers -----------------------------------------------------
1275        def _silverman_bandwidth(x: np.ndarray) -> float:
1276            x = np.asarray(x, float)
1277            n = x.size
1278            if n < 2:
1279                return 0.04
1280            sd = np.std(x, ddof=1)
1281            iqr = np.subtract(*np.percentile(x, [75, 25]))
1282            s = sd if iqr <= 0 else min(sd, iqr / 1.34)
1283            h = 0.9 * s * n ** (-1 / 5)
1284            return float(max(h, 1e-6))
1285
1286        def _kde_unbounded(x: np.ndarray, xs: np.ndarray, h: float) -> np.ndarray:
1287            """
1288            Gaussian KDE on R, implemented with NumPy (no SciPy).
1289            Handles degenerate cases by drawing a small bump at the mean.
1290            """
1291            x = np.asarray(x, float)
1292            if x.size == 0:
1293                return np.zeros_like(xs)
1294            if x.size < 2 or np.std(x) < 1e-12:
1295                mu = float(np.mean(x)) if x.size else 0.0
1296                h0 = max(h, 1e-3)
1297                z = (xs - mu) / h0
1298                return np.exp(-0.5 * z ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h0)
1299            diff = (xs[None, :] - x[:, None]) / h
1300            kern = np.exp(-0.5 * diff ** 2) / (np.sqrt(2 * np.pi) * h)
1301            return kern.mean(axis=0)
1302
1303        def _first_patch_color(patches, fallback):
1304            for p in patches:
1305                fc = p.get_facecolor()
1306                if fc is not None:
1307                    return fc
1308            return fallback
1309
1310        # ---------- Data & columns ---------------------------------------------
1311        df = self.d.df
1312        t_col = treatment or self.d.treatment
1313        y_col = outcome or self.d.outcome
1314        if t_col not in df.columns or y_col not in df.columns:
1315            raise ValueError("Specified treatment/outcome columns not found in DataFrame.")
1316
1317        treatments = pd.unique(df[t_col])  # preserves input order
1318        # Filter rows with valid outcome & treatment
1319        valid = df[[t_col, y_col]].dropna()
1320        if valid.empty:
1321            raise ValueError("No non-missing values for the selected treatment/outcome.")
1322
1323        # ---------- Figure with high DPI & scaled fonts ------------------------
1324        rc = {
1325            "font.size": 11 * font_scale,
1326            "axes.titlesize": 13 * font_scale,
1327            "axes.labelsize": 12 * font_scale,
1328            "legend.fontsize": 10 * font_scale,
1329            "xtick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
1330            "ytick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
1331        }
1332        with mpl.rc_context(rc):
1333            fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=figsize, dpi=dpi)
1334
1335            # ---------- Branch: categorical vs numeric -------------------------
1336            if not pd.api.types.is_numeric_dtype(valid[y_col]):
1337                # CATEGORICAL: normalized grouped bars
1338                vals = pd.unique(valid[y_col])
1339                # Stable, readable category order
1340                vals_sorted = sorted(vals, key=lambda v: (str(type(v)), str(v)))
1341                width = 0.8 / max(1, len(treatments))
1342                x = np.arange(len(vals_sorted))
1343
1344                # Color cycle
1345                cycle = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key().get("color", ["C0", "C1", "C2", "C3"])
1346
1347                for i, tr in enumerate(treatments):
1348                    sub = valid.loc[valid[t_col] == tr, y_col]
1349                    counts = sub.value_counts(normalize=True)
1350                    heights = [float(counts.get(v, 0.0)) for v in vals_sorted]
1351                    ax.bar(x + i * width, heights, width=width, alpha=alpha,
1352                           label=f"{tr} (n={sub.shape[0]})",
1353                           color=cycle[i % len(cycle)],
1354                           edgecolor="white", linewidth=0.6)
1355
1356                ax.set_xticks(x + (len(treatments) - 1) * width / 2)
1357                ax.set_xticklabels([str(v) for v in vals_sorted])
1358                ax.set_ylabel("Proportion")
1359                ax.set_xlabel(str(y_col))
1360                ax.set_title("Outcome distribution by treatment (categorical)")
1361                ax.grid(True, axis="y", linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
1362                for spine in ("top", "right"):
1363                    ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)
1364                ax.legend(title=str(t_col), frameon=False)
1365                fig.tight_layout()
1366
1367            else:
1368                # NUMERIC: overlay histograms (+ optional KDE) per treatment
1369                y_all = valid[y_col].to_numpy()
1370
1371                # Shared x-limits for all treatments if requested
1372                if sharex:
1373                    if clip:
1374                        lo, hi = np.quantile(y_all, [clip[0], clip[1]])
1375                    else:
1376                        lo, hi = np.nanmin(y_all), np.nanmax(y_all)
1377                    if not np.isfinite(lo) or not np.isfinite(hi) or hi <= lo:
1378                        lo, hi = float(np.nanmin(y_all)), float(np.nanmax(y_all))
1379                    hist_range = (float(lo), float(hi))
1380                    ax.set_xlim(*hist_range)
1381                else:
1382                    hist_range = None  # each call to hist will expand limits as needed
1383
1384                # Keep track of colors actually used so KDE/means match
1385                cycle = mpl.rcParams["axes.prop_cycle"].by_key().get("color", ["C0", "C1", "C2", "C3"])
1386                used_colors = {}
1387
1388                # Draw hists
1389                for i, tr in enumerate(treatments):
1390                    y_vals = valid.loc[valid[t_col] == tr, y_col].to_numpy()
1391                    y_vals = y_vals[np.isfinite(y_vals)]
1392                    if y_vals.size == 0:
1393                        continue
1394
1395                    h = ax.hist(
1396                        y_vals,
1397                        bins=bins,
1398                        density=density,
1399                        alpha=alpha,
1400                        label=f"{tr} (n={y_vals.size})",
1401                        range=hist_range,
1402                        edgecolor="white",
1403                        linewidth=0.6,
1404                        color=None,  # let Matplotlib choose
1405                    )
1406                    color_this = _first_patch_color(h[2], cycle[i % len(cycle)])
1407                    used_colors[tr] = color_this
1408
1409                # KDE overlays (SciPy-free, stable)
1410                if kde and len(used_colors) > 0:
1411                    # Build a common grid for smooth lines
1412                    if hist_range is None:
1413                        # Determine from all numeric values (optionally clipped)
1414                        if clip:
1415                            lo, hi = np.quantile(y_all, [clip[0], clip[1]])
1416                        else:
1417                            lo, hi = np.nanmin(y_all), np.nanmax(y_all)
1418                        if not np.isfinite(lo) or not np.isfinite(hi) or hi <= lo:
1419                            lo, hi = float(np.nanmin(y_all)), float(np.nanmax(y_all))
1420                    else:
1421                        lo, hi = hist_range
1422
1423                    xs = np.linspace(float(lo), float(hi), 800)
1424
1425                    for tr in treatments:
1426                        if tr not in used_colors:
1427                            continue
1428                        y_vals = valid.loc[valid[t_col] == tr, y_col].to_numpy()
1429                        y_vals = y_vals[np.isfinite(y_vals)]
1430                        if y_vals.size == 0:
1431                            continue
1432                        hbw = _silverman_bandwidth(y_vals)
1433                        dens = _kde_unbounded(y_vals, xs, hbw)
1434                        # If histogram is counts, scale KDE area roughly to counts for visual parity
1435                        if not density:
1436                            # approximate scaling by total count and bin width near midrange
1437                            bw = (hi - lo) / (bins if isinstance(bins, int) else 30)
1438                            dens = dens * y_vals.size * bw
1439                        ax.plot(xs, dens, linewidth=2.2, color=used_colors[tr],
1440                                label=f"{tr} (KDE)")
1441
1442                # Mean lines
1443                for tr in treatments:
1444                    y_vals = valid.loc[valid[t_col] == tr, y_col].to_numpy()
1445                    y_vals = y_vals[np.isfinite(y_vals)]
1446                    if y_vals.size == 0:
1447                        continue
1448                    mu = float(np.mean(y_vals))
1449                    # Clamp mean line to visible range if sharex & clipped
1450                    if sharex and hist_range is not None:
1451                        mu = float(np.clip(mu, hist_range[0], hist_range[1]))
1452                    ax.axvline(mu, linestyle=":", linewidth=1.8,
1453                               color=used_colors.get(tr, "k"), alpha=0.95)
1454
1455                ax.set_xlabel(str(y_col))
1456                ax.set_ylabel("Density" if density else "Count")
1457                ax.set_title("Outcome distribution by treatment")
1458                ax.grid(True, linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
1459                for spine in ("top", "right"):
1460                    ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)
1461                ax.legend(title=str(t_col), frameon=False)
1462                fig.tight_layout()
1463
1464            # -------- Optional high-res save -----------------------------------
1465            if save is not None:
1466                ext = str(save).lower().split(".")[-1]
1467                _dpi = save_dpi or (300 if ext in {"png", "jpg", "jpeg", "tif", "tiff"} else dpi)
1468                fig.savefig(
1469                    save,
1470                    dpi=_dpi,
1471                    bbox_inches="tight",
1472                    pad_inches=0.1,
1473                    transparent=transparent,
1474                    facecolor="none" if transparent else "white",
1475                )
1476
1477        plt.close(fig)
1478        return fig

1482    def outcome_boxplot(
1483            self,
1484            treatment: Optional[str] = None,
1485            outcome: Optional[str] = None,
1486            figsize: Tuple[float, float] = (9, 5.5),
1487            dpi: int = 220,
1488            font_scale: float = 1.15,
1489            showfliers: bool = True,
1490            patch_artist: bool = True,
1491            save: Optional[str] = None,  # "boxplot.png" / ".svg" / ".pdf"
1492            save_dpi: Optional[int] = None,
1493            transparent: bool = False,
1494    ):
1495        """
1496        Prettified boxplot of the outcome by treatment.
1497
1498        Features
1499        --------
1500        - High-DPI figure, scalable fonts
1501        - Soft modern color styling (default Matplotlib palette)
1502        - Optional outliers, gentle transparency
1503        - Optional save to PNG/SVG/PDF
1504        """
1505        import numpy as np
1506        import pandas as pd
1507        import matplotlib as mpl
1508        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
1509
1510        # --- Data setup --------------------------------------------------------
1511        df = self.d.df
1512        t_col = treatment or self.d.treatment
1513        y_col = outcome or self.d.outcome
1514
1515        if t_col not in df.columns or y_col not in df.columns:
1516            raise ValueError("Specified treatment/outcome columns not found in DataFrame.")
1517
1518        # Drop rows with missing outcome
1519        df_valid = df[[t_col, y_col]].dropna()

1521            raise ValueError("No valid rows with both treatment and outcome present.")

1529            "axes.titlesize": 13 * font_scale,
1530            "axes.labelsize": 12 * font_scale,

1532            "xtick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,
1533            "ytick.labelsize": 10 * font_scale,

1537            fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=figsize, dpi=dpi)

1550                whiskerprops=dict(linewidth=1.0, alpha=0.8),
1551                capprops=dict(linewidth=1.0, alpha=0.8),
1552                medianprops=dict(linewidth=2.0, color="black"),
1553                flierprops=dict(
1554                    marker="o",
1555                    markersize=4,
1556                    markerfacecolor="grey",
1557                    alpha=0.6,
1558                    markeredgewidth=0.3,
1559                ),
1560            )
1561
1562            # --- Colorize boxes with soft fill ---------------------------------
1563            if patch_artist:
1564                for patch, color in zip(bp["boxes"], colors):
1565                    patch.set_facecolor(color)
1566                    patch.set_alpha(0.35)
1567                    patch.set_edgecolor(color)
1568
1569            # --- Titles and cosmetics ------------------------------------------
1570            ax.set_xlabel(str(t_col))
1571            ax.set_ylabel(str(y_col))
1572            ax.set_title("Outcome by treatment (boxplot)")
1573            ax.grid(True, axis="y", linewidth=0.5, alpha=0.45)
1574            for spine in ("top", "right"):
1575                ax.spines[spine].set_visible(False)

1577
1578            # --- Optional save -------------------------------------------------

1580                ext = str(save).lower().split(".")[-1]
1581                _dpi = save_dpi or (300 if ext in {"png", "jpg", "jpeg", "tif", "tiff"} else dpi)
1582                fig.savefig(
1583                    save,
1584                    dpi=_dpi,
1585                    bbox_inches="tight",
1586                    pad_inches=0.1,
1587                    transparent=transparent,
1588                    facecolor="none" if transparent else "white",
1589                )

1643    def m_features(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1644        """Return feature attribution from the fitted m(x) model.
1645        
1646        - CatBoost path: SHAP attributions with columns 'shap_mean' and 'shap_mean_abs',
1647          sorted by 'shap_mean_abs'. Uses transformed feature names from the preprocessor.
1648        - Sklearn path (LogisticRegression): absolute coefficients reported as 'coef_abs'.
1649        """
1650        # Check if model has been fitted
1651        if not hasattr(self, '_fitted_model') or self._fitted_model is None:
1652            raise RuntimeError("No fitted propensity model found. Please call fit_m() first.")
1653        if not hasattr(self, '_feature_names') or self._feature_names is None:
1654            raise RuntimeError("Feature names not available. Please call fit_m() first.")
1655        
1656        if isinstance(self._fitted_model, CatBoostClassifier):
1657            try:
1658                from catboost import Pool
1659                if not hasattr(self, '_X_for_shap') or self._X_for_shap is None:
1660                    raise RuntimeError("Preprocessed data for SHAP computation not available. Please call fit_m() first.")
1661                shap_pool = Pool(data=self._X_for_shap)
1662                shap_values = self._fitted_model.get_feature_importance(type='ShapValues', data=shap_pool)
1663                shap_values_no_bias = shap_values[:, :-1]
1664                shap_mean = np.mean(shap_values_no_bias, axis=0)
1665                shap_mean_abs = np.mean(np.abs(shap_values_no_bias), axis=0)
1666                feature_names = list(self._feature_names)
1667                if len(feature_names) != shap_values_no_bias.shape[1]:
1668                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match SHAP values. Ensure transformed names are used.")
1669                # Adjust shap_mean to have magnitude equal to shap_mean_abs while preserving sign
1670                shap_mean_signed = np.sign(shap_mean) * shap_mean_abs
1671                result_df = pd.DataFrame({
1672                    'feature': feature_names,
1673                    'shap_mean': shap_mean_signed,
1674                    'shap_mean_abs': shap_mean_abs,
1675                })
1676                # Sort by shap_mean_abs (magnitude) descending for determinism
1677                result_df = result_df.sort_values('shap_mean_abs', ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)
1678                # Strip ColumnTransformer/pipeline prefixes like 'num__' or 'cat__' for readability
1679                try:
1680                    result_df['feature'] = result_df['feature'].astype(str).str.replace(r'^[^_]+__', '', regex=True)
1681                except Exception:
1682                    pass
1683                # Augment with probability-scale metrics using baseline p0 = mean m
1684                p0 = float(np.mean(getattr(self, '_m', None))) if hasattr(self, '_m') else np.nan
1685                if not np.isfinite(p0):
1686                    raise RuntimeError("Baseline m estimates not available to compute probability-based columns. Fit m first.")
1687                p0 = float(np.clip(p0, 1e-9, 1 - 1e-9))
1688                logit_p0 = float(np.log(p0 / (1.0 - p0)))
1689                result_df['odds_mult_abs'] = np.exp(result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values)
1690                result_df['exact_pp_change_abs'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean_abs'].values))) - p0
1691                result_df['exact_pp_change_signed'] = 1.0 / (1.0 + np.exp(-(logit_p0 + result_df['shap_mean'].values))) - p0
1692                return result_df
1693            except Exception as e:
1694                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract SHAP values from CatBoost model: {e}")
1695        elif hasattr(self._fitted_model, 'named_steps') and hasattr(self._fitted_model.named_steps.get('clf'), 'coef_'):
1696            try:
1697                clf = self._fitted_model.named_steps['clf']
1698                coef_abs = np.abs(clf.coef_[0])
1699                prep = self._fitted_model.named_steps.get('prep')
1700                if hasattr(prep, 'get_feature_names_out'):
1701                    try:
1702                        feature_names = [str(n) for n in prep.get_feature_names_out()]
1703                    except Exception:
1704                        feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
1705                else:
1706                    feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(len(coef_abs))]
1707                if len(coef_abs) != len(feature_names):
1708                    raise RuntimeError("Feature names length does not match coefficients.")
1709                df = pd.DataFrame({'feature': feature_names, 'importance': coef_abs, 'coef_abs': coef_abs})
1710                # Strip ColumnTransformer/pipeline prefixes like 'num__' or 'cat__' for readability
1711                try:
1712                    df['feature'] = df['feature'].astype(str).str.replace(r'^[^_]+__', '', regex=True)
1713                except Exception:
1714                    pass
1715                df = df.sort_values('importance', ascending=False).reset_index(drop=True)
1716                return df
1717            except Exception as e:
1718                raise RuntimeError(f"Failed to extract feature importance from sklearn model: {e}")
1719        else:
1720            raise RuntimeError(f"Feature importance extraction not supported for model type: {type(self._fitted_model)}")
1721
1722    # Back-compat shim
1723    def treatment_features(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1724        _warn_once("treatment_features()", "m_features()")
1725        return self.m_features()

Exploratory diagnostics for causal designs with binary treatment.

The class exposes methods to:

  • Summarize outcome by treatment and naive mean difference.
  • Estimate cross-validated propensity scores and assess treatment predictability (AUC) and positivity/overlap.
  • Inspect covariate balance via standardized mean differences (SMD) before/after IPTW weighting; visualize with a love plot.
  • Inspect weight distributions and effective sample size (ESS).
CausalEDA( data: Any, ps_model: Any | None = None, n_splits: int = 5, random_state: int = 42) 
793    def __init__(self, data: Any, ps_model: Optional[Any] = None, n_splits: int = 5, random_state: int = 42):
794        roles = _extract_roles(data)
795        self.d = CausalDataLite(df=roles["df"], treatment=roles["treatment"], outcome=roles["outcome"], confounders=roles["confounders"])
796        self.n_splits = n_splits
797        self.random_state = random_state
798        self.ps_model = ps_model or CatBoostClassifier(
799            thread_count=-1,  # Use all available threads
800            random_seed=random_state,
801            verbose=False,  # Suppress training output
802            allow_writing_files=False
803        )
804
805        # Preprocessing: always make features numeric via OneHotEncoder for categoricals
806        X = self.d.df[self.d.confounders]
807        num = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
808        cat = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num]
809
810        num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
811            ("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))
812        ])
813        self.preproc = ColumnTransformer(
814            transformers=[
815                ("num", num_transformer, num),
816                ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat),
817            ],
818            remainder="drop",
819        )
820        
821        self.ps_pipe = Pipeline([("prep", self.preproc), ("clf", self.ps_model)])
822        # Optional: clarify no native categorical indices are used post-OHE
823        self.cat_features = None

def outcome_stats(self) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
854    def outcome_stats(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
855        """Comprehensive outcome statistics grouped by treatment.
856
857        Returns a DataFrame with detailed outcome statistics for each treatment group,
858        including count, mean, std, min, various percentiles, and max.
859        This method provides comprehensive outcome analysis and returns
860        data in a clean DataFrame format suitable for reporting.
861
862        Returns
863        -------
864        pd.DataFrame
865            DataFrame with treatment groups as index and the following columns:
866            - count: number of observations in each group
867            - mean: average outcome value
868            - std: standard deviation of outcome
869            - min: minimum outcome value
870            - p10: 10th percentile
871            - p25: 25th percentile (Q1)
872            - median: 50th percentile (median)
873            - p75: 75th percentile (Q3)
874            - p90: 90th percentile
875            - max: maximum outcome value
876
877        Examples
878        --------
879        >>> eda = CausalEDA(causal_data)
880        >>> stats = eda.outcome_stats()
881        >>> print(stats)
882                count      mean       std       min       p10       p25    median       p75       p90       max
883        treatment                                                                                                
884        0        3000  5.123456  2.345678  0.123456  2.345678  3.456789  5.123456  6.789012  7.890123  9.876543
885        1        2000  6.789012  2.456789  0.234567  3.456789  4.567890  6.789012  8.901234  9.012345  10.987654
886        """
887        df, t, y = self.d.df, self.d.treatment, self.d.outcome
888        
889        # Ensure treatment is numeric for grouping
890        if not pd.api.types.is_numeric_dtype(df[t]):
891            raise ValueError("Treatment must be numeric 0/1 for outcome_stats().")
892        
893        # Create grouped object for multiple operations
894        grouped = df.groupby(t)[y]
895        
896        # Calculate basic statistics using built-in methods
897        basic_stats = grouped.agg(['count', 'mean', 'std', 'min', 'median', 'max'])
898        
899        # Calculate percentiles separately to avoid pandas aggregation mixing issues
900        p10 = grouped.quantile(0.10)
901        p25 = grouped.quantile(0.25) 
902        p75 = grouped.quantile(0.75)
903        p90 = grouped.quantile(0.90)
904        
905        # Combine all statistics into a single DataFrame
906        stats_df = pd.DataFrame({
907            'count': basic_stats['count'],
908            'mean': basic_stats['mean'],
909            'std': basic_stats['std'],
910            'min': basic_stats['min'],
911            'p10': p10,
912            'p25': p25,
913            'median': basic_stats['median'],
914            'p75': p75,
915            'p90': p90,
916            'max': basic_stats['max']
917        })
918        
919        # Ensure the index is named appropriately
920        stats_df.index.name = 'treatment'
921        
922        return stats_df

def fit_m(self) -> PropensityModel: 
925    def fit_m(self) -> 'PropensityModel':
926        """Estimate cross-validated m(x) = P(D=1|X).
927
928        Uses a preprocessing + classifier setup with stratified K-fold to generate
929        out-of-fold probabilities. For CatBoost, data are one-hot encoded via the
930        configured ColumnTransformer before fitting. Returns a PropensityModel.
931        """
932        df = self.d.df
933        X = df[self.d.confounders]
934        t = df[self.d.treatment].astype(int).values
935        if not np.isin(t, [0, 1]).all():
936            raise ValueError("Treatment must be binary {0,1}.")
937        cv = StratifiedKFold(n_splits=self.n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=self.random_state)
938
939        if isinstance(self.ps_model, CatBoostClassifier):
940            import warnings
941            ps = np.zeros(len(X))
942            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
943                with warnings.catch_warnings():
944                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
945                    for train_idx, test_idx in cv.split(X, t):
946                        X_train, X_test = X.iloc[train_idx], X.iloc[test_idx]
947                        t_train = t[train_idx]
948                        X_train_prep = self.preproc.fit_transform(X_train)
949                        X_test_prep = self.preproc.transform(X_test)
950                        model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=self.random_state, verbose=False, allow_writing_files=False)
951                        model.fit(X_train_prep, t_train)
952                        ps[test_idx] = model.predict_proba(X_test_prep)[:, 1]
953        else:
954            import warnings
955            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
956                with warnings.catch_warnings():
957                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
958                    ps = cross_val_predict(self.ps_pipe, X, t, cv=cv, method="predict_proba")[:, 1]
959
960        m = np.clip(ps, 1e-6, 1 - 1e-6)
961        self._m = m
962
963        if isinstance(self.ps_model, CatBoostClassifier):
964            X_full_prep = self.preproc.fit_transform(X)
965            final_model = CatBoostClassifier(thread_count=-1, random_seed=self.random_state, verbose=False)
966            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
967                with warnings.catch_warnings():
968                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
969                    final_model.fit(X_full_prep, t)
970            self._fitted_model = final_model
971            try:
972                self._feature_names = self.preproc.get_feature_names_out().tolist()
973            except Exception:
974                self._feature_names = [f"feature_{i}" for i in range(X_full_prep.shape[1])]
975            self._X_for_shap = X_full_prep
976        else:
977            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
978                with warnings.catch_warnings():
979                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
980                    self.ps_pipe.fit(X, t)
981            self._fitted_model = self.ps_pipe
982            self._feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
983
984        return PropensityModel(
985            m=m,
986            d=t,
987            fitted_model=self._fitted_model,
988            feature_names=self._feature_names,
989            X_for_shap=getattr(self, '_X_for_shap', None)
990        )

def outcome_fit(self, outcome_model: Any | None = None) -> OutcomeModel: 
 997    def outcome_fit(self, outcome_model: Optional[Any] = None) -> 'OutcomeModel':
 998        """Fit a regression model to predict outcome from confounders only.
 999
1000        Uses a preprocessing+CatBoost regressor pipeline with K-fold
1001        cross_val_predict to generate out-of-fold predictions. CatBoost uses
1002        all available threads and handles categorical features natively. Returns an
1003        OutcomeModel instance containing predicted outcomes and diagnostic methods.
1004        
1005        The outcome model predicts the baseline outcome from confounders only,
1006        excluding treatment. This is essential for proper causal analysis.
1007        
1008        Parameters
1009        ----------
1010        outcome_model : Optional[Any]
1011            Custom regression model to use. If None, uses CatBoostRegressor.
1012            
1013        Returns
1014        -------
1015        OutcomeModel
1016            An OutcomeModel instance with methods for:
1017            - scores: RMSE and MAE regression metrics
1018            - shap: SHAP values DataFrame property for outcome prediction
1019        """
1020        df = self.d.df
1021        # Features: confounders only (treatment excluded for proper causal analysis)
1022        X = df[self.d.confounders]
1023        y = df[self.d.outcome].values
1024        cv = KFold(n_splits=self.n_splits, shuffle=True, random_state=self.random_state)
1025        
1026        # Default to CatBoostRegressor if no custom model provided
1027        if outcome_model is None:
1028            outcome_model = CatBoostRegressor(
1029                thread_count=-1,
1030                random_seed=self.random_state,
1031                verbose=False,
1032                allow_writing_files=False
1033            )
1034        
1035        # Identify numeric and categorical features for preprocessing
1036        num_features = X.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns.tolist()
1037        cat_features = [c for c in X.columns if c not in num_features]
1038        
1039        # Setup preprocessing: always OHE categoricals so model input is numeric
1040        num_transformer = Pipeline(steps=[
1041            ("scaler", StandardScaler(with_mean=True, with_std=True))
1042        ])
1043        preproc = ColumnTransformer(
1044            transformers=[
1045                ("num", num_transformer, num_features),
1046                ("cat", OneHotEncoder(handle_unknown="ignore", drop=None, sparse_output=False), cat_features),
1047            ],
1048            remainder="drop",
1049        )
1050        
1051        # Special handling for CatBoost to properly pass categorical features
1052        if isinstance(outcome_model, CatBoostRegressor):
1053            import warnings
1054            
1055            predictions = np.zeros(len(X))
1056            
1057            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1058                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1059                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1060                    
1061                    for train_idx, test_idx in cv.split(X, y):
1062                        # Prepare data for this fold
1063                        X_train, X_test = X.iloc[train_idx], X.iloc[test_idx]
1064                        y_train = y[train_idx]
1065                        
1066                        # Apply preprocessing
1067                        X_train_prep = preproc.fit_transform(X_train)
1068                        X_test_prep = preproc.transform(X_test)
1069                        
1070                        # Create and train CatBoost model for this fold
1071                        model = CatBoostRegressor(
1072                            thread_count=-1,
1073                            random_seed=self.random_state,
1074                            verbose=False,
1075                            allow_writing_files=False
1076                        )
1077                        
1078                        # All features are numeric after preprocessing; no cat_features needed
1079                        model.fit(X_train_prep, y_train)
1080                        predictions[test_idx] = model.predict(X_test_prep)
1081        else:
1082            # Use standard sklearn pipeline for non-CatBoost models
1083            pipeline = Pipeline([("prep", preproc), ("reg", outcome_model)])
1084            import warnings
1085            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1086                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1087                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1088                    predictions = cross_val_predict(pipeline, X, y, cv=cv)
1089        
1090        self._outcome_predictions = predictions
1091        
1092        # Train a final model on the full dataset for SHAP computation
1093        if isinstance(outcome_model, CatBoostRegressor):
1094            # Apply preprocessing to full dataset
1095            X_full_prep = preproc.fit_transform(X)
1096            
1097            # Create and train final model
1098            final_model = CatBoostRegressor(
1099                thread_count=-1,
1100                random_seed=self.random_state,
1101                verbose=False
1102            )
1103            
1104            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1105                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1106                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1107                    final_model.fit(X_full_prep, y)
1108            
1109            # Store the trained model and data needed for SHAP computation
1110            self._outcome_fitted_model = final_model
1111            self._outcome_feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
1112            self._outcome_X_for_shap = X_full_prep  # Store preprocessed data for SHAP
1113        else:
1114            # For non-CatBoost models, fit the pipeline on full data
1115            pipeline = Pipeline([("prep", preproc), ("reg", outcome_model)])
1116            with np.errstate(divide='ignore', invalid='ignore', over='ignore'):
1117                with warnings.catch_warnings():
1118                    warnings.filterwarnings("ignore", category=RuntimeWarning)
1119                    pipeline.fit(X, y)
1120            self._outcome_fitted_model = pipeline
1121            self._outcome_feature_names = X.columns.tolist()
1122        
1123        # Create and return OutcomeModel instance
1124        return OutcomeModel(
1125            predicted_outcomes=predictions,
1126            actual_outcomes=y,
1127            fitted_model=self._outcome_fitted_model,
1128            feature_names=self._outcome_feature_names,
1129            X_for_shap=getattr(self, '_outcome_X_for_shap', None)
1130        )

def confounders_means(self) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1190    def confounders_means(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1191        """Comprehensive confounders balance assessment with means by treatment group.
1192
1193        Returns a DataFrame with detailed balance information including:
1194        - Mean values of each confounder for control group (treatment=0)
1195        - Mean values of each confounder for treated group (treatment=1)
1196        - Absolute difference between treatment groups
1197        - Standardized Mean Difference (SMD) for formal balance assessment
1198        - Kolmogorov–Smirnov statistic (ks) and p-value (ks_pvalue) for distributional differences
1199        
1200        This method provides a comprehensive view of confounder balance by showing
1201        the actual mean values alongside the standardized differences, making it easier
1202        to understand both the magnitude and direction of imbalances.
1203
1204        Returns
1205        -------
1206        pd.DataFrame
1207            DataFrame with confounders as index and the following columns:
1208            - mean_t_0: mean value for control group (treatment=0)
1209            - mean_t_1: mean value for treated group (treatment=1)  
1210            - abs_diff: absolute difference abs(mean_t_1 - mean_t_0)
1211            - smd: standardized mean difference (Cohen's d)
1212            - ks: Kolmogorov–Smirnov statistic
1213            - ks_pvalue: p-value of the KS test
1214            
1215        Notes
1216        -----
1217        SMD values > 0.1 in absolute value typically indicate meaningful imbalance.
1218        Categorical variables are automatically converted to dummy variables.
1219        
1220        Examples
1221        --------
1222        >>> eda = CausalEDA(causal_data)
1223        >>> balance = eda.confounders_means()
1224        >>> print(balance.head())
1225                     mean_t_0  mean_t_1  abs_diff       smd
1226        confounders                                       
1227        age              29.5      31.2      1.7     0.085
1228        income        45000.0   47500.0   2500.0     0.125
1229        education         0.25      0.35      0.1     0.215
1230        """
1231        # Delegate implementation to dedicated balance module for reuse and testing
1232        from .confounders_balance import confounders_balance
1233        return confounders_balance(
1234            df=self.d.df,
1235            treatment=self.d.treatment,
1236            confounders=self.d.confounders,
1237        )

Comprehensive confounders balance assessment with means by treatment group.

Returns a DataFrame with detailed balance information including:

  • Mean values of each confounder for control group (treatment=0)
  • Mean values of each confounder for treated group (treatment=1)
  • Absolute difference between treatment groups
  • Standardized Mean Difference (SMD) for formal balance assessment
  • Kolmogorov–Smirnov statistic (ks) and p-value (ks_pvalue) for distributional differences

This method provides a comprehensive view of confounder balance by showing the actual mean values alongside the standardized differences, making it easier to understand both the magnitude and direction of imbalances.

Returns
  • pd.DataFrame: DataFrame with confounders as index and the following columns:
    • mean_t_0: mean value for control group (treatment=0)
    • mean_t_1: mean value for treated group (treatment=1)
    • abs_diff: absolute difference abs(mean_t_1 - mean_t_0)
    • smd: standardized mean difference (Cohen's d)
    • ks: Kolmogorov–Smirnov statistic
    • ks_pvalue: p-value of the KS test
Notes

SMD values > 0.1 in absolute value typically indicate meaningful imbalance. Categorical variables are automatically converted to dummy variables.
